1.1: In the beginning God created the Heavens and the Earth.
1.2: The Earth was chaos and empty and darkness on the faces of the depths and the Spirit of God hovered on the faces of the waters.
1.3: And God said, “The light shall be”, and the light was.
1.4: And God saw the light that it is beautiful and God separated between the light unto the darkness.
1.5: And God called the light the day, and the darkness he called the night, and it was evening and it was dawn, day one.
1.6: And God said, “The sky shall be in the middle of the waters, and will be separating between the waters unto the waters.”
1.7: And God made the firmament, and it separated between the waters lower than the sky and between the waters that were higher than the sky, and it was in this way.
1.8: And God called the sky, Heaven; and it was evening and it was dawn, day second.
1.9: And God said, “The waters shall be gathered that are lower than Heaven to one region, and the dried land shall appear”, and it was in this way.
1.10: And God called the dried land, Earth, and the assembly of waters he called, the Seas, and God saw that it was excellent.
1.11: And God said, “The Earth shall bring forth new grass, grass that seeds seed for its kind, and the tree of fruit that makes fruit for its kind, of its planting inside it on the Earth”, and it was in this way.
1.12: And the Earth brought out new grass, grass that seeds the seed for its kind, and the tree that makes the fruit of its planting inside it, for its kind, and God saw that it was pleasing.
1.13: And it was evening, and it was dawn, day third.
1.14: And God said, “Lights shall be in the firmament of Heaven to distinguish between daytime and night and they shall be for signs and for times and for days and for years:
1.15: And they shall be giving light in the firmament of Heaven to give light on the Earth”, and it was in this way.
1.16: And God made two great lights: a great light for a ruler of daytime, and one little light for a ruler of the night, and the stars.
1.17: And God gave them in the firmament of Heaven to give light on the Earth,
1.18: And to rule by day and by night and to separate between the light unto the darkness, and God saw that it was good.
1.19: And it was evening, and it was dawn, day fourth.
1.20: And God said, “Swarmers shall swarm the waters, the living soul, and the bird will fly above the Earth, above the face of the firmament of Heaven.”
1.21: And God created the great Dragon and every living soul, swarmers that made the waters swarm with their kinds, and every bird of the wing with its kind, and God saw that it was beautiful.
1.22: And God blessed them and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters that are in the Seas, and the bird will increase in the earth.”
1.23: And it was evening, and it was dawn, day fifth.
1.24: And God said, “The Earth shall produce the living soul with its genus, beast, and creepers, and the beast of the Earth with its kind”, and it was in this way.
1.25: And God made the animal of the Earth with its genus, and the cattle with its genus, and every creeper of the Earth with its kind, and God saw that it was excellent.
1.26: And God said, “We shall make men in our image, according to our form, and they shall rule among the fish of the Sea, and among the birds of Heaven, and among cattle, and among all animals of the Earth, and among all creepers that creep on the Earth.”
1.27: And God created Adam in his image; in the image of God He created him; male and female He created them.
1.28: And God blessed them and God said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the Earth, and subdue it, and rule over the fish of the Sea, and over the fowl of Heaven, and over cattle, and over all animals that creep on the Earth.”
1.29: And God said, “Behold, I have given to you all grass of the seed that bears seed on the face of all the Earth, and every tree that has in itself the fruit of the tree, of its seed, bearing seed; you shall have it for food.
1.30: And every animal of the wilderness and every bird of Heaven and for everything that swarms on the Earth that has in it the living soul and all green grass for food”, and it was so.
1.31: And God saw everything that he had made, and behold, it was very pleasing, and it was evening and it was dawn, the sixth day.

2.1: And they completed Heaven and Earth and all their mighty works.
2.2: And in the sixth day, God finished his works that he made, and he was refreshed in the seventh day from all his works that he had made.
2.3: And God blessed the seventh day and he hallowed it, because in it he rested from all his works that God created to make.
2.4: These are the generations of Heaven and of Earth when they were created, in the day that LORD JEHOVAH God made the Heavens and Earth,
2.5: And there were no trees of the field yet in the Earth, and no grass of the field had yet grown, because LORD JEHOVAH God had not sent down rain on the Earth, and there was no Adam to work in the soil.
2.6: And a spring did rise up from the Earth and did give drink to all the face of the Earth.
2.7: And LORD JEHOVAH God formed Adam of the dust from the soil, and breathed into his face the breath of life, and Adam was a living soul.
2.8: And LORD JEHOVAH God planted Paradise in Eden from the first and he put there Adam whom he formed.
2.9: And LORD JEHOVAH God made to grow from the Earth every tree that is desirable to see and good to eat, and the tree of life in the middle of Paradise, and the tree of knowledge of the good and of the evil.
2.10: And a river was going out from Eden for its watering to Paradise, and from there it separates and it came to four heads.
2.11: The name of one is Pyshon, that goes around to all the land of Khaweela, where there is gold;
2.12: And the gold of the land is good; there is Beryl and there are stones of Beryl.
2.13: And the name of the second river is Gihon, which goes around to all the land of Kush.
2.14: And the name of the third river is Deqlath—Tigris, that goes opposite Assyria, and the fourth river is Euphraates.
2.15: And LORD JEHOVAH God took Adam and he left him in the Paradise of Eden to cultivate it and to keep it.
2.16: And LORD JEHOVAH God commanded Adam and said to him, “From all of the trees that are in Paradise you shall eat:
2.17: And from the tree of knowledge of good and of evil you shall not eat from it, because in the day that you will eat from it, you will die the death.”
2.18: And LORD JEHOVAH God said, “It is not good for Adam to be alone. I shall make a helper for him like himself.”
2.19: And LORD JEHOVAH God formed from the Earth every animal of the wilderness, and every bird of Heaven, and he brought them to Adam to see what he called them, and everything that Adam called them, each living soul, that is its name.
2.20: And Adam called names for all cattle, and all birds of Heaven, and all animals of the Earth, and for Adam there was not found a Helper like him.
2.21: And LORD JEHOVAH God cast stillness on Adam and he slept, and he took one of his ribs and he closed the flesh in its place.
2.22: And LORD JEHOVAH God formed the rib that he took from Adam into a Woman and brought her to Adam.
2.23: And Adam said, “This time it is the bones from my bones and the flesh from my flesh; this one will be called Woman, because she was taken from Man.”
2.24: Because of this, a man shall leave his father and his mother and shall cleave to his wife and they shall be the two of them one flesh.
2.25: And they were both naked, Adam and his wife, and they were not ashamed.

3.1: And the Serpent was craftier than every animal of the wilderness that LORD JEHOVAH God had made, and the Serpent said to the Woman, “Has God truly said that you will not eat from all the trees of Paradise”?
3.2: And the woman said to the Serpent, “From the fruit of all of the trees that are in Paradise we shall eat:
3.3: And from the fruit of the tree that is in the middle of Paradise God said, “You shall not eat from it and you shall not touch it, lest you shall die.’
3.4: And the Serpent said to the Woman, “You shall not really die:
3.5: Because God knew that in the day that you eat from it, your eyes are opened and you are like God, knowing the good and the evil.”
3.6: And the woman saw that it was a tree good to eat, and was desirable to the eyes, and a tree desirable to gaze at, and she took from its fruit and ate, and she gave also to her husband with her and he ate.
3.7: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked, and they fastened leaves of figs and they made loincloths for themselves.
3.8: And they heard the voice of LORD JEHOVAH God walking in Paradise to the declining of the day, and they hid themselves, Adam and his wife, from before LORD JEHOVAH God within the trees that were in Paradise.
3.9: And LORD JEHOVAH God called to Adam, and he said to him, “Where are you, Adam”?
3.10: And he said, “I heard your voice in Paradise, and I saw that I was naked, and I hid myself.”
3.11: And LORD JEHOVAH said to him, “Who showed you that you are naked? Behold, have you eaten from the tree of which I ordered you, that you shall not eat from it?”
3.12: And Adam said, “The woman whom you have given with me, she gave to me from the tree, and I ate.”
3.13: And LORD JEHOVAH God said to the woman, “What is this that you have done?” And the woman said, “The Serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
3.14: And LORD JEHOVAH God said to the Serpent, “Because you have done this, you are cursed more than all cattle, and more than every animal of the wilderness, and upon your belly you will walk, and you will eat dust all the days of your life:
3.15: And I shall put hatred between you and the Woman, and between your seed and her seed. He shall tread upon your head and you will strike him in his heel.”
3.16: And he said to the woman, “I shall increase and multiply your diseases and your pregnancies; in sorrow you will bear children, and unto your husband you will turn, and he will be authorized over you.”
3.17: And to Adam He said, “Because you listened to the voice of your wife, and you ate from the tree that I ordered you and said to you, that you shall not eat from it, Earth is cursed because of you; in sorrows you will eat of it all the days of your life;
3.18: Thorns and thistles it will grow for you, and you will eat the grass of the field;
3.19: In the sweat of your face you will eat bread, until you return to the Earth, for from it you were taken, because dust you are and to dust you shall return.”
3.20: And Adam called the name of his wife Khawa, because she was the mother of everyone who lives.
3.21: And LORD JEHOVAH God made for Adam and his wife coats of leather, and he clothed them.
3.22: And LORD JEHOVAH God said, “Behold, Adam has become as one of us, to know good and evil; now, lest he reach his hand and he will take also from the tree of life and he will eat and will live to eternity.”
3.23: And LORD JEHOVAH God sent him from Paradise of Eden to cultivate the Earth, the place from which he was taken.
3.24: And LORD JEHOVAH God sent him out and he made revolve, from the East of Paradise of Eden, Cherubim and the point of a sword, that turns to keep the way of the tree of Life.

4.1: And Adam had sexual intercourse with Eve his wife and she became pregnant and she bore Qayn, and she said, “I have obtained a man for LORD JEHOVAH.”
4.2: And she added to give birth to his brother Habyl, and Habyl was a Shepherd of sheep, and Qayn was a Farmer in the earth.
4.3: And it was that after some days, Qayn brought from the fruit of the ground an offering to LORD JEHOVAH.
4.4: And Habyl brought also that from the first born of his flocks, and from their fat, and LORD JEHOVAH was pleased with Habyl and his offering.
4.5: And with Qayn and with his offering he was not pleased, and it displeased Qayn greatly, and his face was sad.
4.6: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Qayn, “Why does it seem evil to you, and why was your face saddened?
4.7: Behold, if you do right, I accept it, and if you will not do right, sin lies in wait before the door; you are going to be converted to it and it will have authority over you.”
4.8: And Qayn said to Habyl his brother, “Let us proceed to the plain”; and it was that when they were in a field, Qayn arose against Habyl his brother and killed him.
4.9: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Qayn, “Where is Habyl your brother?” And he said, “I do not know, for am I my brother’s keeper?
4.10: And LORD JEHOVAH said to him, “What have you done? The voice of the blood of your brother cries to me from the Earth.
4.11: Therefore, you are cursed from the Earth that has opened her mouth and she has received the blood of your brother from your hands
4.12: When you shall cultivate in the earth, she will not increase when she gives to you her power; shaken and trembling you will be in the earth.”
4.13: And Qayn said to LORD JEHOVAH, “My crime is greater than what may be forgiven.
4.14: Behold, you have cast me out today from the face of the Earth, and I shall be hidden from before you, and I shall be shaken and trembling in the earth, and everyone whoever will find me will kill me”
4.15: And LORD JEHOVAH said to him, “No! Anyone murdering Qayn shall each be paid sevenfold in this way.” And LORD JEHOVAH laid a sign on Qayn, so that no one who finds him would kill him.
4.16: And Qayn went out from before LORD JEHOVAH and dwelt in the land of Nod—Trembling, from the East of Eden.
4.17: And Qayn had sexual relations with his wife, and she conceived, and she bore Khenok, and he was the builder of a city, and he called the name of the city by the name of his son, Khenok.
4.18: And Aydar was born to Khenok, and Aydar begot Mekhuyl, and Mekhuyl begot Methushyl, and Methushyl begot Lamek.
4.19: And Lamek took to himself two wives; the name of one was Ada and the name of the other was Tsala.
4.20: And Ada bore Yabal; he was the father to tent dwellers and cattle owners.
4.21: And the name of his brother was Yubal; he was the father to all who hold the psaltery and harp.
4.22: And Tsala also gave birth to Tubal Qayn, a worker in every work of brass and of iron, and the sister of Tubal Qayn was Naama.
4.23: And Lamek said to his wives, Ada and Tsala: “Hear my voice, wives of Lamek; incline to my speech, because I have killed a man with my wounds, and a boy with my beating.
4.24: Because Qayn shall be rewarded sevenfold, and Lamek seventy and seven.”
4.25: And Adam had sexual relations again with Eve, his wife, and she conceived, and she bore a son, and she called his name Shayth, because God gives to me another seed for the sake of Habyl, whom Qayn killed.”
4.26: And also to Shayth a son was born, and he called his name Enosh; then he began to call on the Name of LORD JEHOVAH.

5.1: This is the scroll of the generations of Adam in the day that God created Adam; He created him in the form of God;
5.2: Male and female He created them and God blessed them and he called their name Adam in the day that he created them.
5.3: And Adam lived a hundred and thirty years, and he begot in his likeness, according to his image, and he called his name Shayth:
5.4: And Adam lived eight hundred years after he begot Shayth, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.5: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years, and he died.
5.6: And Shayth lived a hundred and five years, and he begot Enosh:
5.7: And Shayth lived from after he begot Enosh, eight hundred and seven years, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.8: And all the days of Shayth were nine hundred and twelve years, and he died.
5.9: And Enosh lived ninety years and he begot Qaynan:
5.10: And Enosh lived after he begot Qaynan, eight hundred and fifteen years, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.11: And all his days of Enosh were nine hundred and five years, and he died.
5.12: And Qaynan lived seventy years and he begot Mehalaleil:
5.13: And Qaynan lived after he begot Mehalaleil, eight hundred and forty years, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.14: And all the days of Qaynan were nine hundred and ten years, and he died.
5.15: And Mehalaleil lived sixty and five years and begot Yared:
5.16: And Mehalaleil lived after he begot Yared, eight hundred and thirty years, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.17: And all the days of Mehalaleil were eight hundred and ninety and five years, and he died.
5.18: And Yared lived a hundred and sixty and two years, and he begot Khenok:
5.19: And Yared lived after he begot Khenok, eight hundred years, and begot sons and daughters:
5.20: And all the days of Yared were nine hundred and sixty and two years, and he died.
5.21: And Khenok lived sixty and five years and begot Methushelakh:
5.22: And Khenok was pleasing to God, after he begot Methushelakh, three hundred years, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.23: And all the days of Khenok were three hundred and sixty and five years.
5.24: And Khenok pleased God, and he was not, because God took him.
5.25: And Methushelakh lived a hundred and eighty and seven years and begot Lamek:
5.26: And Methushelakh lived, after he begot Lamek, seven hundred and eighty and two years, and he begot sons and daughters:
5.27: And all the days of Methushelakh were nine hundred and sixty and nine years, and he died.
5.28: And Lamek lived two hundred years and begot a son:
5.29: And he called his name Noah, and said, “This one will comfort us from our works, and from the labor of our hands, and from the Earth which LORD JEHOVAH cursed.”
5.30: And Lamek lived, after he begot Noah, five hundred and ninety and five years, and begot sons and daughters:
5.31: And all the days of Lamek were seven hundred and seventy and seven years, and he died.
5.32: And Noah was a son of five hundred years, and Noah begot Shym and Kham and Yapheth.

6.1: And it was that when sons of men began to multiply on the face of the Earth and daughters were born to them,
6.2: the Sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were beautiful and they took those women to them of all that they chose.
6.3: And LORD JEHOVAH said: “My Spirit will not dwell in man for eternity because he is flesh and his days shall be a hundred and twenty years.”
6.4: And giants were in the earth in those days, also after this, because the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men and they gave birth to the giants that were from of old, the Heroes of fame.
6.5: And LORD JEHOVAH saw that the evil of man increased in the earth and every inclination of the reasonings of his heart was evil every day.
6.6: And LORD JEHOVAH regretted that he had made Adam in the earth, and he was grieved in his heart.
6.7: And LORD JEHOVAH said, “I shall wipe out the children of men that I have created from the face of the Earth, from the children of men and unto the animal and unto the creeping thing and unto the bird of the sky, because I am sorry that I have made them.”
6.8: And Noah found favor in the eyes of LORD JEHOVAH.
6.9: And these are the generations of Noah: Noah was a righteous and perfect man in his generations and Noah pleased God.
6.10: And Noah begot three sons: Sheem and Kham and Yapeth.
6.11: And the Earth was corrupted before God and the Earth was filled with evil.
6.12: And God saw the Earth that it was corrupted because everybody had corrupted his way on the Earth.
6.13: And God said to Noah, “The end of everybody has entered before me, because the Earth is filled with evil from before them; behold I shall destroy them with the Earth.
6.14: Make for you an ark of the wood of acacia box wood; make it stories for the ark and smear it from outside and from inside with pitch.
6.15: And thus make the length of the ark three hundred cubits and its width fifty cubits and its height thirty cubits.
6.16: And make a window for the ark and a cubit above; finish it from above, and the door of the ark in its side; make a story below and make it a second and a third.
6.17: And I, behold, I am bringing the flood waters on the Earth to destroy all flesh that has in it the Spiritbreath of life from under Heaven, and everyone that is in Earth will end.
6.18: And I will establish my covenant with you, and you will enter the ark, you and your sons, and your wife, and the wives of your sons with you.
6.19: And two of everything that lives of all flesh, bring to the ark to save with you; they shall be male and female.
6.20: From the bird with its kind and from the beast with its kind and from every creeping thing of the Earth with its kinds, two by two of every one, they shall enter with you to the ark.
6.21: And you take for yourselves from every food that is eaten, and gather to yourselves, and it will be yours and theirs for food.”
6.22: And Noah did all that God commanded him; in this way he did.

7.1: And God said to Noah, “Enter you and all your house to the ark, because you I have seen that you are righteous before me in this generation.
7.2: And of every pure beast take to yourselves seven by seven, male and female, and from the beast that is not pure, two by two, male and female.
7.3: Also from a bird of Heaven, seven by seven, male and female, to save seed on the face of all the Earth.
7.4: Because after seven days I am sending down rain on the Earth forty days and forty nights, and shall blot out everything that lives, which I have made, from the face of the Earth.”
7.5: And Noah did everything that LORD JEHOVAH commanded him.
7.6: And Noah was a son of six hundred years, and there was a flood of waters on the Earth.
7.7: And Noah entered, and his children, and his wife, and the wives of his sons with him into the ark from before the waters of the flood.
7.8: And of the pure cattle and of the herd animal that was not pure, and of the bird, and from every creeper on the Earth,
7.9: Two by two they entered with Noah into the ark, male and female, as God commanded Noah.
7.10: And seven days passed and the water of the flood was on the Earth.
7.11: In the six hundredth year of the years of the life of Noah, in the second month, in the seventeenth in the month, in it in this day, all springs of the great depths exploded, and the floodgates of Heaven were opened.
7.12: And there was rain on the Earth forty days and forty nights.
7.13: On it on this day, Noah entered the ark and Sheem and Kham and Yapheth, sons of Noah, and the wife of Noah and the three wives of his sons with him;
7.14: Those and every animal by its kind, and every beast by its kind, and every creeper that creeps on the Earth by their kinds, and every bird by its kind and every small bird and every winged creature.
7.15: They entered with Noah by two into the ark, two of all flesh that had in them the SpiritBreath of life.
7.16: And they that entered, male and female, of all flesh, they entered as God commanded him, and LORD JEHOVAH shut in its door.
7.17: And the flood was forty days on the Earth, and the waters increased, and they lifted the ark and it was lifted up from the Earth.
7.18: And the waters prevailed and increased much on the Earth and the ark was moving on the face of the waters.
7.19: And the waters prevailed greatly on the Earth and all the high mountains were covered under all of Heaven.
7.20: The waters exceeded fifteen cubits higher and covered the mountains.
7.21: And all flesh ended that creeps on the Earth bird, and herd animal, and the wild beast, and all the creepers that creep on the Earth, and all children of men:
7.22: Everything that had the breath of the Spirit of life in its nostrils, of everything that was on dry land, died.
7.23: And he blotted out all that live on the face of the Earth, from children of men and unto the domestic animal, and unto the creeper, and unto the bird of Heaven; they were wiped out from the Earth, and Noah remained and those with him in the ark.
7.24: And the waters increased on the Earth a hundred and fifty days.

8.1: And God remembered Noah and all the animals and all the cattle and every bird that was with him in the ark, and God made the wind pass over upon the Earth, and the waters were calmed;
8.2: And the fountains of the Abyss and the floodgates of Heaven were shut, and the rain was restrained from Heaven;
8.3: And the waters returned from the Earth; they were going and were returning, and the waters decreased after a hundred and fifty days.
8.4: And the ark came to rest in the seventh month, in the seventeenth of the month, on the mountains of Qardu—Kurdish.
8.5: And the waters were going and they were decreasing until the tenth month, in the first of the tenth month, the tops of the mountains appeared.
8.6: And it was after forty days, Noah opened the window of the ark that he had made:
8.7: And he sent a raven and it went out, going forth, and it did not return until the waters dried up from the Earth.
8.8: And he sent a dove from his presence, to see if the waters had receded from the face of the Earth;
8.9: And the dove did not find rest itself, for the sole of its foot, and it returned to the ark, because the waters there were on the face of all the land, and he reached his hand and he took it and brought it to him on the ark.
8.10: And he waited again seven more days, and he returned and he sent the dove from the ark;
8.11: And the dove came to him at evening time, and behold, a leaf of olive was held in its mouth, and Noah knew that the waters had receded from the face of the Earth.
8.12: And he waited again seven days more, and he sent the dove, and the dove did not return again to him.
8.13: And it was in the year six hundred and one, on the first of the first month, the waters dried up from the Earth, and Noah removed the cover of the ark, and he saw, and behold, the face of the Earth was dried.
8.14: And in the second month, on the twentyseventh of the month, the Earth was dried.
8.15: And God spoke with Noah and he said to him,
8.16: “Go out from the ark, you and your wife and your children and the wives of your sons with you.
8.17: And all the animals that are with you, of all flesh, and the birds, and domestic animals, and all creeping things that creep on the Earth, bring out with you, and they will reproduce in the Earth, and they will be fruitful and they will multiply on the Earth.
8.18: And Noah went out, and his wife, and his children, and the wives of his sons with him:
8.19: And all animals, and all cattle, and every bird, and every creeper on the Earth, with their generations, went out from the ark.
8.20: And Noah built an altar to LORD JEHOVAH and he took from all pure animals and from every pure bird, and he offered up burnt offering on the altar.
8.21: And LORD JEHOVAH smelled the fragrance of the savor the fragrance of pleasure, and LORD JEHOVAH said in his heart, “I shall not add again to curse the Earth because of a son of man, because the inclination of the heart of a son of man is evil from his childhood, and I shall not add again to strike all that lives, as I have done.
8.22: And from now, all of the days of the Earth, seed and harvest, frost and heat, summer and winter, daytime and night, shall not cease.”

9.1: And God blessed Noah and his children and said to them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the Earth.
9.2: And the fear of you and the trembling of you will be on every animal of the Earth, and upon every bird of Heaven, and upon everything that crawls the Earth and all fish of the sea; they are given up into your hands.
9.3: And every creeping thing that lives shall be yours for food; as the green grass I have given everything to you.
9.4: Only the flesh whose blood is in itself you shall not eat.
9.5: And however, your blood of your lives I shall require from the agency of every animal; it will be required from the agency of a man and I shall require the life of a man from the agency of a man and his brother.
9.6: Whoever will shed the blood of man, by man his blood shall be shed, because Adam was made in the image of God.
9.7: And you, be fruitful and multiply and reproduce in the earth and multiply in it.”
9.8: And God said to Noah and to his sons with him:
9.9: “Behold, I am establishing my covenant with you and with your seed after you;
9.10: And with every living soul that is with you, and with bird and with beast, and with every animal of the Earth that is with you, of all leaving the ark and with every animal of the Earth.
9.11: And I shall establish my covenant with you, and all flesh shall not end again by the waters of a flood, and there shall not be a flood again to destroy the Earth.”
9.12: And God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant that I am giving between me and you and between every soul living that is with you, for the generations of the world:
9.13: My rainbow I have given in the clouds, and it shall be the sign of my covenant between me and the Earth.
9.14: And it will be, when I bring out a cloud over the Earth, and the bow will be seen in the clouds:
9.15: I shall remember my covenant that is between me and you and between every living soul that is with you, and between all flesh, and there shall not be again the waters of a flood to destroy all flesh;
9.16: And there will be a bow in the clouds and I shall see it for a memorial of the eternal covenant between God and between every soul living of all flesh that is upon earth.”
9.17: And God said to Noah, “This is the sign of the covenant that I have established between myself and between all flesh that is upon Earth.”
9.18: And the sons of Noah that came out from the ark were Shym and Kham and Yaphet; Kham was the father of Canaan.
9.19: These three are the sons of Noah and from these they were scattered in all the Earth.
9.20: And Noah began working in the earth and he planted a vineyard:
9.21: And he drank from its wine and he was drunk and he was exposed within the tent.
9.22: And Kham the father of Canaan saw the nakedness of his father and he showed his two brothers.
9.23: And Sheem and Yaphet took a cloak and they threw it over both their shoulders and they walked backward and covered the nakedness of their father and their faces were toward their back and they did not the nakedness of their father.
9.24: And Noah was awakened from his wine and knew everything that his youngest son had done to him.
9.25: And he said, “Canaan is cursed, he shall be a Servant of Servants to his brothers.”
9.26: And he said, “LORD JEHOVAH the God of Sheem is blessed and Canaan will be a Servant to them.
9.27: God will enlarge Yapheth and he will dwell in the tabernacle of Sheem and Canaan will be a Servant to them.”
9.28: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.
9.29: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years, and he died.

10.1: And these are the generations of the children of Noah, Sheem and Kham and Yapheth, and children were born to them after the flood.
10.2: The children of Yaphet: Gamar and Magog and Maday and Yavan and Tubyl and Meshek and Tyras.
10.3: And the children of Gamar: Ashknaz and Dayphar and Tugarma.
10.4: And the children of Yavan: Elisha and Tarshish and Katheem and Doraneem.
10.5: And from these they are set apart in the islands of the nations in their lands, a man to his language, by their families in their nations.
10.6: And the children of Kham: Cush and Metsraym and Phut and Canaan.
10.7: And the children of Cush: Sheba and Khavila and Sabta and Rama and Sebathka; and the children of Rama: Sheba and Daran.
10.8: And Cush begot Nemruud; he began to be a champion in the earth.
10.9: He was a champion hunter before LORD JEHOVAH; because of this, it is said, “As Nimruud the champion hunter before LORD JEHOVAH.”
10.10: And it was the beginning of his Kingdom of Babel, and Arak and Akar and Kalia in the land of Senar.
10.11: From that land the Assyrians went out and built Nineva and the city Rakhbuth and Kalakh.
10.12: And Rasaan of the house of Nineva and the house of Kalakh, it is a great city.
10.13: And Metsraym begot Ludeem and Yabeem, Lahbeem and Yaphtukheem.
10.14: And Pathruseem and Kaslukheem, for the Philistines and Qapaduqians had gone from there.
10.15: And Canaan begot Tsidon, his firstborn, and Khethites,
10.16: And Yebusites, and Amorites, and Gergusites,
10.17: And Kharites, and Arqites, and Sinites,
10.18: And Arudites, and Tsamrites, Khamathites, and after this the families of the Canaanites were spread out.
10.19: And the border of the Canaanites was from Tsidon, that was in the entrance of Gadar, and unto Aza that was in the entrance of Sadom, and of Ammora and of Adma and of Tsebuim unto Lesha.
10.20: These are the sons of Kham with their families with their languages, in their lands, in their nations.
10.21: And Sheem begot sons also, the father of all children of Eber, the brother of Yapheth the great.
10.22: The children of Sheem: Ilam and Ashur, and Arphakshar, and Lud and Aram.
10.23: And the children of Aram: Uts and Khul and Gathar and Mash.
10.24: And Arphakshar begot Shalakh and Shalakh begot Abar.
10.25: And to Abar were born two sons: the name of one, Palag, because in his days the Earth was divided, and the name of his brother, Yaqtan.
10.26: And Yaqtan begot Elmodad and Shalaph, and Khetsarmuth, and Yarakh,
10.27: And Hadoram, and Uzel, and Deqla,
10.28: And Ubal, and Abimal, and Sheba,
10.29: And Auphir, and Khwila, and Yubab all of them; these are the children of Yaqtan.
10.30: And their dwelling was from Manasheh that is in the entry of Sepharweem, a mountain in the East.
10.31: These are the sons of Sheem with their families, with their languages, in their lands, in these their peoples.
10.32: The families of the children of Noah with their generations with their families among their peoples; and from these the nations in the earth were set apart after the flood.

11.1: And the whole Earth was one language and one speech.
11.2: And it was that when they picked up from the East, they found a valley in the land of Senar and they dwelt there.
11.3: And they said each man to his neighbor: “Come, we will lay bricks and we will burn them in fire.” And they had brick for stone and they had lime for mortar.
11.4: And they said, “Come, we will build up a city for ourselves and a tower whose top is in Heaven, and let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered on the face of all the Earth.”
11.5: And LORD JEHOVAH came down to see the city and the tower that the children of men were building.
11.6: And LORD JEHOVAH said, “Behold, the people are one and they all have one language and thus they have conceived to do, therefore nothing would be taken from them that they have conceived to do.
11.7: Come, let us descend and we will divide there the language so that a man will not hear his neighbor's language.”
11.8: And LORD JEHOVAH scattered them from there on the face of all the Earth, and they stopped building the city.
11.9: Because of this, He called its name Babel, because there LORD JEHOVAH confused the language of all the Earth, and from there LORD JEHOVAH scattered them on the face of all the Earth.
11.10: And these are the generations of Sheem: Sheem, son of a hundred years, begot Arphakshar two years after the flood:
11.11: And Sheem lived five hundred years after he had begotten Arphakshar, and begot sons and daughters.
11.12: And Arphakshar lived thirty and five years and he begot Shalakh:
11.13: And Arphakshar lived four hundred and three years after he had begotten Shalakh, and he begot sons and daughters.
11.14: And Shalakh lived thirty years and begot Abar:
11.15: And Shalakh lived four hundred and three years after he had begotten Abar, and begot sons and daughters.
11.16: And Abar lived thirty and four years, and he begot Palag:
11.17: And Abar lived four hundred and thirty years after he had begotten Palag and begot sons and daughters.
11.18: And Palag lived thirty years and begot Arau:
11.19: And Palag lived two hundred and nine years after he had begotten Arau and begot sons and daughters.
11.20: And Arau lived thirty and two years and begot Serug:
11.21: And Arau lived two hundred and seven years after he had begotten Serug and begot sons and daughters.
11.22: And Serug lived thirty years and begot Nakhor:
11.23: And Serug lived two hundred years after he had begotten Nakhor and begot sons and daughters.
11.24: And Nakhor lived twenty and nine years and begot Terakh:
11.25: And Nakhor lived a hundred nineteen years after he had begotten Terakh and begot sons and daughters.
11.26: And Terakh lived seventy and five years and begot Abram and Nakhor and Haran.
11.27: And these are the generations of Terakh: Terakh begot Abram and Nakhor and Haran, and Haran begot Lot.
11.28: And Haran died in the lifetime of Terakh his father, in the land where he was begotten in Ur of the Chaldeans.
11.29: And Abram and Nakhor took to themselves women; the name of the wife of Abram: Sarai, and the name of the wife of Nakhor: Milka, daughter of Haran, the father of Milka and father of Isca.
11.30: And Sarai was a sterile woman and she had no sons.
11.31: And Terakh took Abram his son and Lot, son of Haran, son of his son, and Sarai his daughter in law, the wife of Abram his son, and they went out with them from Ur of the Chaldeans to go to the land of Canaan and they came unto Kharan and they dwelt there.
11.32: And the days of Terakh were two hundred and five years and Terakh died in Kharan.

12.1: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Abram: “Go from your land and from where you were born and from the house of your father to the land I shall declare to you:
12.2: And I shall make you a great people and I shall bless you and I shall enlarge your name and it will be blessed:
12.3: And I shall bless those blessing you, and those cursing you I shall curse, and in you and in your seed all the generations of the Earth shall be blessed.”
12.4: And Abram did as LORD JEHOVAH said to him and Lot went on with him and Abram was seventy and five years old when he went out from Kharan.
12.5: And Abram took Sarai his wife and Lot the son of his brother and all their possessions that they owned and the souls that they had produced in Kharan, and they went out to go to the land of Canaan and they came to the land of Canaan.
12.6: And Abram passed by in the land unto the region of Shekim and unto the oak of Mamrey and the Canaanites were still dwelling in the land.
12.7: And LORD JEHOVAH was revealed unto Abram and said to him: “To your seed I shall give this land.” And he built there an altar to LORD JEHOVAH who was revealed unto him.
12.8: And he departed from there to a mountain from the East to BaythEil and he pitched a tabernacle, BaythEil from the West and Ai from the East, and he built there an altar to LORD JEHOVAH and he called on the Name of LORD JEHOVAH.
12.9: And Abram picked up and he went on and picked up to the south.
12.10: And there was a famine in the land and Abram came down to Egypt to dwell there because the famine was very severe in the land.
12.11: And it was that when he approached to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, “Behold, I know that you are a woman beautiful in appearance:
12.12: And when the Egyptians will see you they will say, ‘This is his wife’; they will murder me and save you.
12.13: Say, ‘I am his sister’, so that it will be good for me because of you and my soul will live because of you.”
12.14: And it happened that when Abram entered Egypt, the Egyptians saw his wife that she was very beautiful.
12.15: And the Princes of Pharaoh saw her and praised her before Pharaoh, and the woman was led to the house of Pharaoh.
12.16: And it was good for Abram because of her, and he had sheep and bulls and donkeys and male Servants and female Servants and female donkeys and camels.
12.17: And LORD JEHOVAH struck Pharaoh with great plagues, and the children of his house, because of Sarai, the wife of Abram.
12.18: And Pharaoh called Abram and said to him, “What is this that you have done to me? Why did you not show me that she is your wife?
12.19: And why did you say ‘She is my sister’, and I have taken her to me as a wife? Now, behold, take your wife and go.”
12.20: And Pharaoh commanded a man concerning him and he sent him out, him and his wife and everything that he had.

13.1: And Abram came up from Egypt, he and his wife, and everything that he had, and Lot with him to the south.
13.2: And Abram was very rich in cattle and in silver and in gold.
13.3: And he went on to his journey from the south and unto BaythEil, as far as to the place where he had pitched his tent at the first, between BaythEil and Ai;
13.4: To the place of the altar that he had made there at the first, and Abram called there on the Name of LORD JEHOVAH.
13.5: And also Lot, who went with Abram there, had sheep and oxen and tents in great abundance.
13.6: And that land was not sustaining them to dwell together because their cattle were very abundant, and they were not able to dwell together.
13.7: And there was strife among the herdsmen of the cattle of Abram between the herdsmen of the cattle of Lot, and the Canaanites and the Perizzites were still dwelling in the land.
13.8: And Abram said to Lot, “There will not be strife between me and you and between my herdsmen and your herdsmen because we men are brothers.
13.9: Behold, all the land is before you. Separate from me; if you are to the right, I am to the left, and if you are to the left, I am to the right.”
13.10: And Lot lifted his eyes and he saw all the land of Jordan, that all the place was watered, before LORD JEHOVAH would destroy Sadom and Amora, as the Paradise of God and like the land of Egypt that was in the entrance of Zoan.
13.11: And Lot chose for himself all the land of Jordan and Lot picked up from the East and they parted, each man from his brother.
13.12: Abram dwelt in the land of Canaan and Lot dwelt in the villages that were around, and he possessed as far as Sadom.
13.13: And men of Sadom were evil and great sinners before LORD JEHOVAH.
13.14: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Abram after Lot parted from him: “Lift your eyes and see from the place where you are to the north and to the south and to the east and to the west:
13.15: Because all the land that you see, to you I shall give it and to your seed unto eternity.
13.16: And I shall make him, your seed, as the dust of the Earth so that if you can count the dust of the Earth, your seed also will be counted.
13.17: Arise; walk in the land to its length and to its width because to you I shall give it.”
13.18: And Abram came and entered and sat down among the oaks of Mamrey the Amorite, which is in Khebron, and he built there an altar to LORD JEHOVAH.

14.1: And it was in the days of Amarphel the King of Sinar and Ariok the King of Dalasar and Kardlamar the King of Ilaam and Tareel the King of Gelaya;
14.2: They made war with Baara the King of Sadom and with Bersha the King of Amora and Shenab the King of Adama and Shemair the King of Tsebuim and the King of Baala this is Tsaar.
14.3: All of these were gathered to the valley Sedumia, that is the Sea of Salt.
14.4: Twelve years they served Kardlaamar; the thirteenth year they rebelled.
14.5: And in year fourteen Kardlaamar came and the Kings that were with him and they struck the mighty men who were in Asteroth Qornim and the warriors who were among them and the Emney who were in Shwa Qurathim;
14.6: And Khorites that were in the mountains of Sair unto the oak of Pharan that is in the wilderness.
14.7: And they returned and they came to Ayn Deena, which is Raqim, and they struck all the Princes of the Amaleqites and also the Amorites that dwelt in Ayn Ged.
14.8: And the King of Sadom went out and the King of Amora, and the King of Adama, and the King of Tsebuim, and the King of Baala this is Tsaar; all of these made war in the valley of Sedumia;
14.9: With Kardlamar the King of Ileem, and Trayl the King of Galia, and Amarphel the King of Senar, and Ariok the King of Dalasar, four Kings with five.
14.10: And the valley of Sedumia was pits upon pits of tar and the Kings of Sadom fled and the King of Amora and they fell there, and those who survived fled to the mountains.
14.11: And they took all the possessions of Sadom and of Ammora and all their food and they went.
14.12: And they took Lot, son of the brother of Abram, and his possessions, and they went and he dwelt in Sadom.
14.13: And one came who was allowed to escape and he showed Abram the Hebrew and he was dwelling among the oaks of Mamrey the Amorite, brother of Anir and the brother of Ashkul, and those allies of Abram.
14.14: And Abram heard that the son of his brother was captured and he armed his three hundred and eighteen young men born in his house and he pursued after them unto Dan.
14.15: And he and his Servants split up against them in the night and they struck them and they chased them until Khuba that is by the left of Darmsuq.
14.16: And they returned all the possessions, also he returned Lot, son of his brother, and his possessions, also the wives also the people.
14.17: And the King of Sadom went out to meet him after he returned when he destroyed Kardlaamar and the Kings with him in the valley of Shwa that is the Valley of the Kings.
14.18: And Melkizedeq, King of Shalim, brought out bread and wine, and he was the Priest of God, Most High.
14.19: And he blessed him and said, “Blessed is Abram to God the Highest, Possessor of Heaven and Earth:
14.20: And blessed is God the Highest who delivered your enemies into your hands”, and he gave to him a tenth of everything.
14.21: And the King of Sadom said to Abram, “Give to me the souls, and the possessions take to yourselves.
14.22: And Abram said to the King of Sadom, “I have lifted my hands to God the Highest the Possessor of Heaven and Earth,
14.23: I shall never take from a thread or unto a leather strap of a shoe of anything that you have, lest you will say ‘I have made Abram rich’:
14.24: Apart from anything that the young men ate and the portion of the men that went with me, Anir and Ashkul and Mamrey, those shall receive their portion.

15.1: After these answers was the answer of LORD JEHOVAH to Abram in a vision and he said to him: “Do not fear Abram; I shall support you, your very great reward.”
15.2: And Abram said: “LORD JEHOVAH God, what will you give to me, for I have gone without sons, and Eliezar of Darmsuq, a tenant of my house, is heir to me?”
15.3: And Abram said, “Behold, you have not given me a son, and behold, a tenant of my house is heir to me.”
15.4: And LORD JEHOVAH said to him: “This shall not be your heir, but your son who proceeds from your loins, he will be your heir.”
15.5: And he sent him outside and said to him, “Look into Heaven and count the stars, if you can number them”; and he said to him, “So your seed shall be.”
15.6: And Abram believed in God and it was accounted to him for righteousness.
15.7: And he said to him, “I AM LORD JEHOVAH who brought you out from Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land to inherit it.”
15.8: And Abram said, “LORD JEHOVAH, God, by what shall I know that I am heir to it”?
15.9: And he said to him, “Take to you a threeyearold calf and a threeyearold ram and a three year old goat and a pigeon and a son of doves.
15.10: And he took to him all of these and divided them equally and laid the members against its counterpart and he did not divide the birds.
15.11: And a bird of prey was descending on the carcasses and Abram was driving it off.
15.12: And it happened that the sun was setting, and silence fell on Abram, and behold, fear and great darkness fell upon him.
15.13: And he said to Abram, “Surely you shall know that your seed shall be an inhabitant in a land that is not theirs, and they shall serve them, and they shall subject them four hundred years;
15.14: Also the people whom they serve I judge, and after this they will go out with great possessions.
15.15: And you shall be gathered to your fathers in peace and you shall be buried in a good old age.
15.16: And in the fourth age they shall return here, because the debts of the Amorites are not yet fulfilled.
15.17: And the sun was setting; there was darkness and behold, a furnace that smoked and a lamp of fire that passed between these halves.
15.18: In that day LORD JEHOVAH established a covenant with Abram and said to him: “To your seed I shall give this land from the river of Egypt and unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
15.19: The Qenites and the Qenezites and the Qadmunites.
15.20: And the Khithites and the Perezites and the Giants.
15.21: And the Amorites and the Canaanites and the Gergusites and the Yebusites.

16.1: And Sarai the wife of Abram did not give birth for him and he had a female Egyptian Servant and her name was Hagar.
16.2: And Sarai said to Abram, “Behold, LORD JEHOVAH has denied me offspring. Enter into my female Servant; doubtless I shall be comforted from her.” And Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.
16.3: And Sarai, the wife of Abram, brought Hagar the Egyptian her Handmaid after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and she gave her as a wife to Abram her husband.
16.4: And he entered into Hagar and she conceived, and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
16.5: And Sarai said to Abram, “My wrong is upon you! I have given my female Servant into your bosom, and when she saw that she conceived, I was despised in her eyes! LORD JEHOVAH will judge between me and you!”
16.6: And Abram said to Sarai his wife, “Behold, your maid is delivered into your hands; do to her whatever is good in your eyes.” and Sarai her mistress treated her shamefully and she fled from before her.
16.7: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH found her at a spring of waters in the wilderness in the road of Gadar.
16.8: And he said to her, “Hagar, Handmaid of Sarai, from where are you coming and where are you going?” and she said, “I am running away from before Sarai, my Mistress.”
16.9: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH said to her, “Return to your Mistress and be subject under her hand.”
16.10: And he said to her, “Multiplying I shall multiply your seed and it will not be counted because of its immensity.”
16.11: And the Angel of LORD JEHOVAH said to her, “Behold, you are pregnant and are to give birth to a son, and you shall call his name Ishmayl, because LORD JEHOVAH heard in your servitude.
16.12: And he shall be a savage of the children of men; his hand is against everyone and the hand of everyone against him, and he shall dwell upon the borders of all his brothers.”
16.13: And she called the name of LORD JEHOVAH who spoke with her and she said: “You are God in a vision”, because she said, “Behold, also I saw the vision after it saw me.”
16.14: Because of this, she called this well “Beer D'Khaya Khezan"; behold, it is between Raqeem and Gadar.
16.15: And Hagar bore a son to Abram, and Abram called the name of his son, who was born to him, whom Hagar had given birth to by him, Ishmayl; and Abram was eighty and six years old when Hagar gave birth to Ishmayl by Abram.
16.16: And Abram was ninety and nine years old and LORD JEHOVAH was revealed unto Abram and said to him, “I AM El Shaddai God; be pleasing before me and be without defect.

17.1: And I shall give my covenant between me and you and I shall increase you greatly.”
17.2: And Abram fell on his face and God spoke with him and said to him,
17.3: “Behold, I do establish my covenant with you and you shall be the father to the multitude of the nations.
17.4: And your name shall not be called Abram again, but your name shall be Abraham, because I have given you as the father to the multitude of the nations.
17.5: And I shall make you fruitful, and I shall increase you greatly, and I shall give you the nations, and Kings will go out from your loins.
17.6: And I shall establish my covenant between me and you and between your seed after you to their generations for an eternal covenant and I shall be God to you and to your seed after you.
17.7: And I shall give you and your seed after you the land of your pilgrimage, all the land of Canaan for an eternal inheritance, and I shall be God to them.”
17.8: And God said to Abraham, “You keep my covenant, you and your seed after You, for their generations.
17.9: This is my covenant to observe between me and you and between your seed after you, that you shall circumcise every male.
17.10: And you shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and you.
17.11: And a son of eight days shall be circumcised among you, every male for your generations, born in the house, and bought with money from any son of a foreigner that was not from your seed.
17.12: To circumcise, let the one born in your house and bought with your silver be circumcised, and my covenant will be in your flesh for an eternal covenant.
17.13: And the uncircumcised male whose flesh of his foreskin will not be circumcised, that soul will be destroyed from his people; he has withdrawn from my covenant.”
17.14: And God said to Abraham, “You shall not call the name of Sarai your wife, Sarai, because Sara is her name.
17.15: And I shall bless her, and also I shall give to you a son from her, and I shall bless him and he shall be for the nations, and Kings of the nations shall be from him.”
17.16: And Abraham fell on his face and laughed, and said in his heart, “To a son of a hundred years shall a son be born, or shall Sara, a daughter of ninety years, bear?”
17.17: And Abraham said to God, “Oh that Ishmayl may live before you!”
17.18: And God said to Abraham, “Truly Sara your wife shall give birth to a son for you, and you shall call his name Isaaq, and I shall establish my covenant with him for an eternal covenant and with his seed after him.
17.19: And I have heard you about Ishmayl; behold I have blessed him and I shall increase him and I shall make him abound very greatly. He shall beget twelve Princes and I shall give him a great people.
17.20: And I shall establish my covenant with Isaaq, for Sara will give birth for you at this time next year.”
17.21: And when He had finished speaking with Him, God was lifted up from Abraham.
17.22: And Abraham took Ishmayl, his son, and every child in his house and every one purchased by his money, every male among the men in the house of Abraham, and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskin in the same day, just as God spoke with Him.
17.23: And Abraham was a son of ninety and nine years when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin.
17.24: And Ishmayl his son was a son of thirteen years when he circumcised the flesh of his foreskin.
17.25: In this day Abraham circumcised Ishmayl his son.
17.26: And all the men in his house, born in his house and purchased with his money, and also he circumcised with him some sons of foreigners.
17.27: And LORD JEHOVAH was revealed unto him among the oaks of Mamrey, and he sat in the door of the tent when the day was hot;

18.1: And he lifted his eyes, and he saw, and behold, three men standing over by him, and he saw them and he ran to meet them from the door of the tent, and he bowed on the ground,
18.2: And he said, “LORD JEHOVAH, if I have found favor in your eyes, do not pass on from your Servant:
18.3: I shall take a little water and I shall wash your feet and recline under the tree:
18.4: And take a piece of bread and sustain your heart, and after this, pass on, because in this manner you have come unto your Servant” and they said, “In this manner do as you have said.”
18.5: And Abraham made haste and he ran to the tent to Sara and said, “Quickly knead three
18.6: gallon measures fine flour and make flat cakes.”
18.7: And Abraham ran to the herd and he took one fat and good calf and he gave it to a boy and he hurried to prepare it.
18.8: And he took butter and milk and the calf that he prepared and set before them, and he stood over them under the tree, and they ate.
18.9: And they said to him, “Where is Sara your wife?”, and he said, “Here, in the tent.”
18.10: And he said to him, “Returning, I shall return to you at this time when she is living, and Sara your wife shall have a son”, and Sara heard at the door of the tent and it was behind him.
18.11: And Abraham and Sara were old and they had advanced in years; the way of women had departed from Sara.
18.12: And Sara laughed in her heart and she said, “After I am worn out will I have youth, and my Lord is old?”
18.13: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Abraham: “Why did Sara laugh and say, ‘Truly, shall I give birth when I am old?’
18.14: Is the matter greater than LORD JEHOVAH?, for at this time I shall return to you when she is living, and Sara your wife shall have a son.”
18.15: And Sara denied, and she said, “I did not laugh”, because she was afraid; and he said, “No, but you did laugh.”
18.16: And the men got up from there and gazed on the face of Sadom; Abraham went with them to accompany them.
18.17: And LORD JEHOVAH said: “Will I hide from my Servant Abraham the thing that I do;
18.18: And Abraham is going to be for a great people and many, and all of the nations of the Earth shall be blessed in him?
18.19: Because I know him, that he commands his children and the children in his house after him, so that they keep the ways of LORD JEHOVAH to do righteousness and judgment, because LORD JEHOVAH shall bring on Abraham what he said about him.”
18.20: And LORD JEHOVAH said: “The bellowing of Sadom and of Ammora has entered before me, and their sins are very grievous,
18.21: I shall descend; I shall see if they have done and they have fulfilled according to the bellowing that has come to me, otherwise I shall know.”
18.22: And the men turned from there and they went to Sadom, and Abraham was still standing before LORD JEHOVAH.
18.23: And Abraham came near and said, “Do you destroy the righteous in a rage with sinners?
18.24: If there are fifty righteous within the city, do you destroy in a rage and do you not forgive the place because of fifty righteous who are within it?
18.25: Let it not be for you to make this response, that you would kill the innocent with the guilty! And will the innocent be as the guilty? May it not be for you, the Judge of all the Earth! This judgment should not be done!”
18.26: And LORD JEHOVAH said: “If I shall find in Sadom fifty righteous within the city, I shall forgive all the place because of them.”
18.27: And Abraham answered and said, “Behold, I have begun to speak before LORD JEHOVAH, and I am dust and ashes.
18.28: And if five are lacking from fifty righteous, will you destroy the entire city because of five?” And he said, “I shall not destroy if I find there forty and five.”
18.29: And Abraham added again to say to him, “And if forty are found there?” And he said, “I shall not destroy if I find forty there.”
18.30: And he said, “Let it not be evil to LORD JEHOVAH, and I shall speak; and if thirty are found there?” and he said “I shall not destroy if I find thirty there.”
18.31: And he said, “Behold, I have begun to speak before LORD JEHOVAH; and if twenty are found there?” And he said, “I shall not destroy for twenty.”
18.32: And he said, “Let it not be evil to LORD JEHOVAH, and I shall speak only this time; and if ten are found there?” And he said, “I shall not destroy for ten.”
18.33: And LORD JEHOVAH went on when He had finished speaking with Abraham, and Abraham returned to his place.

19.1: And two Messengers came to Sadom in the evening, and Lot sat at the gate of Sadom, and Lot saw them and stood to meet them, and he bowed on his face on the ground.
19.2: And he said, “I beg of you my Lords, turn aside to the house of your Servant and stay the night and wash your feet and rise early, go your way.” And they said, “No, we will stay in the street.”
19.3: And Lot urged them greatly, and they turned aside to him and they entered his house, and he made them drink, and he baked unleavened bread for them and they ate.
19.4: And yet they did not sleep, and the men of the city, the men of Sadom, surrounded the house, the young men to the old men, and all the people from its limits.
19.5: And they called Lot and they said to him, “Where are the men who came to you in the night? Bring them out to us and we will know them.”
19.6: And Lot went out to them at the door and he shut the door after him.
19.7: And Lot said to them, “You shall not do evil, my brothers.
19.8: Behold I have two daughters that not have known a man; I shall bring them out to you, and do to them just as is good in your eyes, only do nothing to these men, for they have entered the shade of my city.”
19.9: And they said, “Get back!” and they said, “One came to dwell with us and behold, the Judge judges us; now we will do worse to you than to them”, and Lot fought with the men greatly, and they approached to break down the door.
19.10: And the men stretched out their hands and brought Lot to them to the house and they locked the door.
19.11: And they struck the men who were at the door of the house with hallucinations, from the little ones and unto the great, and they labored to find the door.
19.12: And the men said to Lot, “What are you doing here? Bring out your inlaws and your sons and your daughters from this place, and all that you have in the city.
19.13: For we are destroying this region, because their bellowing has come up before LORD JEHOVAH, and LORD JEHOVAH sent us for its destruction.”
19.14: And Lot went out and he spoke with his sonsinlaw, takers of his daughters, and he said to them, “Get up, go out from this place, because LORD JEHOVAH is destroying it” and it was as if he was joking in the eyes of his sonsinlaw.
19.15: And when dawn came up, the Messengers urged Lot, and they were saying to him, “Arise, take your wife and your two daughters who have been found, lest you be devoured in the sins of the city.”
19.16: And Lot delayed, and the Messengers seized his hand and the hand of his wife and the hand of his two daughters, because LORD JEHOVAH showed pity upon him, and they brought him out and they set him outside of the city.
19.17: And when they brought them outside, they were saying to him, “Save yourself; do not turn behind you and do not stay in all the valleys; escape to the mountain lest you be destroyed.”
19.18: And Lot said to them, “I beg of you, my Lords.
19.19: Behold, your Servant has found mercy in your eyes and your kindness is abundant which you have served with me to save my life, and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest evil will overtake me and I would die.
19.20: Behold this city is near to flee there and it is small. I may escape there; behold it is small, and my soul will live.”
19.21: And he said to him, “Behold, I have accepted your person also in this response, so that I shall not overturn the city of which you have spoken.
19.22: Escape there quickly, because I cannot do anything until you enter there”; because of this, he called the name of the city, Tsaar.
19.23: The sun came out over the land and Lot entered Tsaar.
19.24: And LORD JEHOVAH sent down on Sadom and upon Amora brimstone and fire from before LORD JEHOVAH from Heaven.
19.25: And he overturned these villages and all the plain and all dwellers of the land and the vegetation of the land.
19.26: And his wife turned from behind him and she became a pillar of salt.
19.27: And Abraham came early at dawn to the region where he had stood there before LORD JEHOVAH.
19.28: And he gazed at the face of Sadom and Amora and at the face of all the land of the plain, and he saw, and behold, the smoke of the land went up like the smoke of a furnace.
19.29: And it was that when God destroyed the cities of the plain, God remembered Abraham, and he sent Lot from within the upheaval, when He overturned the cities where Lot had dwelt among them.
19.30: And Lot came up from Tsaar and sat down in the mountain, he and his two daughters with him, because he was afraid to sit in Tsaar, and he and his two daughters sat down in a cave.
19.31: And the elder woman said to the younger, “Behold our father is old and there is no man in the earth to come into us according to the way of all the Earth.
19.32: Come, we will give wine to drink to our father, and we will lie with him and we will raise up seed from our father.”
19.33: And they gave wine to drink that night to their father, and the elder woman entered and she lay with her father, and he did not know her lying down or her rising up.
19.34: And it was the next day, and the elder said to the younger, “Behold I slept in the evening with my father; we will give him wine to drink also tonight, and you go in, lie with Him, and we will raise up seed from our father.”
19.35: And they gave wine to drink also that night to their father, and the younger entered and she lay with him, and he did know her lying down or her rising up.
19.36: And the two daughters of Lot conceived from their father.
19.37: And the elder woman bore a son and she called his name Moab; he is the father of the Moabites until today.
19.38: And the younger also gave birth to a son, and she called his name, Bar Ammi; he is the father of the children of Amon until today.

20.1: And Abraham picked up from there to the land of the south and he dwelt between Raqim and Gadar, and Abraham settled in Gadar.
20.2: And Abraham said about Sara his wife, “She is my sister” and Abimelek the King of Gadar sent and he took Sara.
20.3: And God came upon Abimelek in a dream of the night and said to him: “Behold, you die for the sake of the woman whom you have taken, because she is the wife of a man.
20.4: And Abimelek did not touch her and Abimelek said, “LORD JEHOVAH, do you also kill innocent people?
20.5: Behold, he said, ‘She is my sister’, and also she said, ‘He is my brother.’ I have done this in the perfection of my heart and in the purity of my hands.”
20.6: And God said to him in a dream “I know also that in perfection of your heart you have done this and I have restrained you also that you would not sin against me; because of this I did not let you touch her.
20.7: Now return the wife of the man, because he is a prophet, and he will pray for you and you will live, and if you do not return her, know that surely you die, and everyone that you have.”
20.8: And Abimelek arose early at dawn and he called all his Servants and he spoke all these words in their ears, and the men were very afraid.
20.9: And Abimelek called Abraham and said to him, “What have I done to you, and what have I sinned against you, that you have brought great sins against me and against My kingdom? You have done with me deeds that are not done.”
20.10: And Abimelek said to Abraham, “What did you see, that you have made this response?”
20.11: And Abraham said, “Because I said, ‘Lest there is not the awe of God in this place and they kill me for the sake of my wife.’
20.12: However, she is truly my sister, the daughter of my father, and not the daughter of my mother, and she became to me a wife.
20.13: And it was that when God brought me out from my father's house, I said to her, ‘Do this favor for me in every place where we are going; say about me there, "He is my brother”.’
20.14: And Abimelek took sheep and bulls and Servants and Maids and he gave them to Abraham and returned Sara his wife to him.
20.15: And Abimelek said to Abraham, “Behold, shepherd before you; dwell wherever it is excellent in your eyes.”
20.16: And to Sara he said, “Behold, I have given one thousand silver pieces to your brother, and behold, that also has been given to you because you were concealed from the eyes of everyone that is with me, and about everything you proved me wrong.”
20.17: And Abraham prayed before God, and God healed Abimelek and his wife and his maids, and they gave birth.
20.18: Because shutting, LORD JEHOVAH had shut every womb of the house of Abimelek publicly, because of Sara the wife of Abraham.

21.1: And LORD JEHOVAH remembered Sara as he had said, and LORD JEHOVAH did for Sara as he had said.
21.2: And Sara conceived and she bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the time of which God had spoken with him.
21.3: And Abraham called the name of his son, Isaaq, who was begotten by him, to whom Sara had given birth.
21.4: And Abraham circumcised Isaaq his son, a son of eight days, as God commanded him.
21.5: And Abraham was a hundred years old when Isaaq his son was born to him.
21.6: And Sara said, “God has made great joy for me today. Everyone who hears will rejoice with me.”
21.7: And she said, “Who said to Abraham that Sara will breastfeed children? For I have given birth to a son for him in his old age.”
21.8: And the boy grew and was weaned and Abraham made a great feast in the day that Isaaq was weaned.
21.9: And Sara saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian laughing, to whom Hagar had given birth by Abraham.
21.10: And she said to Abraham, “Cast out this Maidservant and her son, because the son of this maid will not inherit with my son Isaaq.”
21.11: And the response was very distressing in the eyes of Abraham, concerning the matter of his son.
21.12: And God said to Abraham: “Do not let it be distressing in your eyes, concerning the boy, and concerning your Maidservant. Listen to her voice in everything that Sara spoke to you, because your seed shall be called in Isaaq.
21.13: Also I shall make the son of the maid a great people because he is your seed.”
21.14: And Abraham arose at dawn and he took bread and a skin of waters and he gave it to Hagar and laid it and the boy on her shoulder, and he sent her away and she went and she wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba.
21.15: And the waters from the skin were finished and she laid the boy under one of the shrubs.
21.16: And she went and she sat far off; she removed about the shot of a bow because she said, “I will not see the death of the boy”, and she sat far off and she lifted her voice and she wept.
21.17: And God heard the voice of the boy and the Angel of God called to Hagar from Heaven and said to her, “What is happening to you Hagar? Do not be afraid, because God has heard the voice of the boy where he is.
21.18: Arise, pick up the boy and hold your hands firmly on him, because I shall make him a great nation.”
21.19: And God opened her eyes and she saw a well of waters and she went and filled the skin with water and gave drink to the boy.
21.20: And God was with the boy and he grew and he dwelt in the wilderness of Paran and he did learn the bow in the wilderness of Paran.
21.21: And his mother took for him a woman from the land of Egypt.
21.22: And it was at that time, Abimelek and Phikol, Captain of his army, said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do:
21.23: And now swear to me by God here, that you will not lie to me and to my family and to my descendants, and according to the favor that I have done with you, do with me and with the land in which you dwell.”
21.25: And Abraham reproved Abimelek concerning a matter of a well of waters that the Servants of Abraham had dug and the Servants of Abimelek had taken it.
21.26: And Abimelek said, “I did not know who did this matter, also you did not show me, neither had I heard except only today.”
21.27: And Abraham took sheep and oxen and he gave to Abimelek and both of them established a covenant.
21.28: And Abraham set seven ewes of sheep by themselves.
21.29: And Abimelek said to Abraham, “What are these seven ewes of sheep that you have set by themselves?”
21.30: And he said, “Take from my hands the seven ewes so that it may be a testimony to me that I have dug this well.”
21.31: Because of this he called that place Beersheba, because there both of them had sworn.
21.32: And they made a covenant in Beersheba; Abimelek and Phikol the Captain of his army rose up and they returned to the land of the Philistines.
21.33: And Abraham had planted a plant in Beersheba and he called there on the Name of LORD JEHOVAH, The God of the universe.
21.34: And Abraham went through in the land of the Philistines for many days.

22.1: And it was after these matters God tested Abraham and said to him, “Abraham”, and he said, “Here I am.”
22.2: And he said to him: “Take your son your only one, Isaaq, whom you love, and you go to the land of the Amorites and offer him up there for a sacrifice on one of the mountains of which I shall tell you.”
22.3: And Abraham arose early at dawn and saddled his donkey and he took two of his young men with him, and Isaac his son, and split wood for an offering and arose, and he went to the region about which God had told him.
22.4: And the third day Abraham lifted his eyes and he saw that place from a distance.
22.5: And he said to his young men, “Stay here with the donkey and I and the boy will go there and we will worship and will return to you.”
22.6: And Abraham took wood for the offering and he laid it on Isaaq his son, and he took fire in his hand and a knife and they both went as one.
22.7: And Isaaq spoke to Abraham his father and he said, “Father”, and he said, “Here I am my son”, and he said to him, “Here is the fire and the wood; where is a lamb for an offering?
22.8: And Abraham said, “God will show himself the Lamb for a sacrifice, my son”, and they both went as one.
22.9: And they came to the region of which God had told him and Abraham built there the altar and he arranged the wood and he tied up Isaaq his son and he placed him on the altar on the wood.
22.10: And Abraham reached his hand and he took the knife to slaughter his son.
22.11: And the Angel of God called to him from Heaven and said, “Abraham, Abraham” and he said, “Here I am.”
22.12: And he said, “Do not stretch your hand against the boy and you shall not do anything to him, because now I have made known that you are in awe of God, for you have not kept your son, your only one, from me.”
22.13: And Abraham lifted his eyes, and he saw and behold, one ram caught in the branches by his horns, and Abraham went and he took the ram and offered him up as an offering in place of his son.
22.14: And Abraham called the name of that place “LORD JEHOVAH will appear” of which it is said today, “In this mountain LORD JEHOVAH will appear.”
22.15: And the Angel of God called to Abraham the second time from Heaven,
22.16: And he said, “By myself I have sworn, says LORD JEHOVAH, because you have made this response and you have not kept back your son, your only one, from me:
22.17: To bless, I shall bless you, and to multiply, I shall multiply your seed as the stars of Heaven and like the sand that is upon the shore of the sea, and your seed shall inherit the lands of his enemies;
22.18: And all of the people of the Earth shall be blessed in your seed, because you listened to my voice.”
22.19: And Abraham returned to his young men and they stood and they went as one to Beersheba and Abraham dwelt in Beersheba.
22.20: And it happened after these matters and it was shown to Abraham and they said to him, “Behold, Melka also gave birth to children by Nakhor your brother;
22.21: To Uuts, his first born, and to his brother Buuz, and to Qemuyel, the father of Aram.
22.22: And to Kasar, and to Khazu, and to Palrash, and to Yarlaph and to Bethuyel,
22.23: And Bethuyel begot Raphqa; Melka gave birth to these eight by Nakhor the brother of Abraham.”
22.24: And his concubine’s name was Ruma, and she bore also Tebakh, Gakham, Thakhash and Maaka.

23.1: And the life of Sara was a hundred and twenty and seven years, the years of the life Sara.
23.2: And Sara died in Qorith Ganbarey (Town of Giants)—this is Khebron, which is in the land of Canaan, and Abraham came to mourn over Sara and to weep for her.
23.3: And Abraham stood up before his dead and he spoke with the sons of Khyth and said to them,
23.4: “I am a settler and a pilgrim with you; give to me the inheritance of a tomb with you and I shall bury my dead before me.”
23.5: And the sons of Khyth answered and they said to Abraham.
23.6: “Hear us our Lord; you are a Prince of God among us. Bury your dead in the best of our tombs. No man of us will deny you his tomb to bury your dead.”
23.7: And Abraham stood and he bowed to the people of the land to the sons of Khyth.
23.8: And he spoke with them and said to them: “If your souls are willing that I bury my dead from before me, hear me and ask for me of Aphron son of Tsakhar,
23.9: And he will give me his double cave that is beside his field for full cost; let him give it to me among you for an inheritance of a tomb.”
23.10: And Aphron dwelt among the sons of Khyth, and Aphron the Khythite answered and said to Abraham before the sons of Khyth and before everyone entering the gate of his city, and he said,
23.11: “No, my Lord, hear me; I have given you the field and I have given the cave in it to you before my sons with me; I give it to you; bury your dead.”
23.12: And Abraham bowed before the people of the land.
23.13: And he said to Aphron before the people of the land, “If you will hear me, I shall give to you the money estimate of the field; take it from me and I shall bury my dead there.”
23.14: And Aphron answered and said to Abraham,
23.15: “My Lord, hear me; the land is four hundred shekels of money. What is it between me and you? Bury your dead.”
23.16: And Abraham listened to Aphron and Abraham weighed for Aphron the money of which he spoke before the sons of Khyth, four hundred shekels of silver that goes to the merchants.
23.17: And the field of Aphron stood that was in Iphtha, next to Mamrey, the field and the cave which was in it, and all the trees in the field that were in the surrounding border.
23.18: To Abraham they were sold before the sons of Khyth and before everyone entering the gate of the city.
23.19: And after this, Abraham buried Sara his wife in the cave of Iphtha in the field that is next to Mamrey; this is Khebron that is in the land of Canaan.
23.20: And the field of the cave remained, and the cave which is in it, for Abraham as an inheritance of the tomb which was with the sons of Khyth.

24.1: And Abraham was old and advanced in years and LORD JEHOVAH blessed Abraham in everything.
24.2: And Abraham called his old Servant, the Chief in his house, who was authorized in everything that he had, and he said to him, “Put your hand under my loins:
24.3: And I shall make you swear by LORD JEHOVAH, God of Heaven and God of the Earth, that you will not take a woman for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites whom live I among them:
24.4: But go to my land and to my family, and take a woman for my son, Isaaq.”
24.5: And the Servant said to him, “And if the woman does not desire to come after me to return to this land, shall I return your son to the land from where I came out?”
24.6: And Abraham said to him, “Beware that you do not return my son there.
24.7: LORD JEHOVAH God of Heaven who led me from there, from the house of my father, from the land of my family, and who spoke to me and who made a covenant with me: “To your seed I shall give this land”, he will send His Angel before you and you will take a woman for my son from there.
24.8: And if the woman will not be persuaded to come with you, you are blameless of this my oath, only you will not return my son there.”
24.9: And the Servant laid his hand under the loins of Abraham, his lord, and he swore to him concerning this matter.
24.10: And the Servant took ten camels from the camels of his Master and from every blessing of his Master in his hand and he went on and he arose and he went on to Aram Nahrayn, to the village of Nakhor.
24.11: And he knelt his camels outside of the village at a well of waters at evening time, at the time that they come out to fill up with water.
24.12: And he prayed and said, “LORD JEHOVAH God of my Master Abraham, prepare before me today and perform favor with my Master Abraham.
24.13: Behold I am standing at a well of waters and the daughters of the men the city come out to fill up water:
