26.10: And the Earth opened her mouth and swallowed them and Qorakh in the plague of the assembly when fire consumed two hundred and fifty men, and they were for a sign.
26.11: And the sons of Qorakh did not die.
26.12: And the sons of Shemon for their tribes: Yemuyel, the family of Yemuyel, Yamni, the family of Yamni, Yakhin, the family of Yakhin.
26.13: Zerakh, the family of Zerakh, Shaul, the family of Shaul.
26.14: These are the families of Shemon: twenty and two thousand and two hundred.
26.15: And the sons of Gad for their tribes: Tsephon, the family of Tsephon, Khaggi, the family of Khaggi, Shuni, the family of Shuni.
26.16: Azni, the family of Azni, Adi, the family of Adi.
26.17: Arudi, the family of Arudi, Adil, the family of Adil.
26.18: These are the families of the sons of Gad for their number: forty thousand and five hundred.
26.19: And the sons of Yehuda: Eir and Unan, and Eir and Unan died in the land of Canaan.
26.20: And the sons of Yehuda by their tribes were Shela, the family of Shela, Pharets, the family of Pharets, Zerakh, the family of Zerakh.
26.21: And the sons of Pharets were Khetsron, the family of Khetsron, Khamul, the family of Khamul.
26.22: These are the families of the sons of Yehuda for their number: seventy and six thousand and five hundred.
26.23: And the sons of Issakar for their families: Tula, the family of Tula, Pua, the family of Pua.
26.24: Yashub, the family of Yashub, Shemon, the family of Shemon.
26.25: These are the families of Issakar for their number: sixty and four thousand and three hundred.
26.26: And the sons of Zebulon for their families: Sadar, the family of Sadar, Alun, the family of Alun, Nakhlayel, the family of Nakhlayel.
26.27: These are the families of Zebulon for their number: sixty thousand and five hundred.
26.28: And the sons of Yoseph for their families: Menasheh and Aphrim.
26.29: And the sons of Menasheh: Makir, the family of Makir, and Makir begot Gelad: Gelad, the family of Gelad.
26.30: And these are the sons of Gelad: Yezir, the family of Yezir, Kheleq, the family of Kheleq:
26.31: Ashdayel, the family of Ashdayel: Shekim, the family of Shekim:
26.32: Shamida, the family of Shamida: Khaphar, the family of Khaphar:
26.33: And Tsalphkhad son of Khaphar did not have sons, but daughters; and the names of the daughters of Tsalphkhad: Mekhla and Yaa and Khagla and Melka and Tartsa.
26.34: And these are the families of Menasheh, and their number was fifty and two thousand and seven hundred.
26.35: And the sons of Aphreim for their families: Shuthelakh, the family of Shuthelakh, Bakar, the family of Bakar, Takhan, the family of Takhan.
26.36: And these are the sons of Shuthelakh: Edan, the family of Edan.
26.37: These are the families of the sons of Aphreim by their number, thirty and two thousand and five hundred; these are the sons of Yoseph by their families.
26.38: And the sons of Benyamin for their families: Bala, the family of Bala, Ashbel, the family of Ashbel, Akhiram, the family of Akhiram.
26.39: Shupham, the family of Shupham, Khuphim, the family of Khuphim.
26.40: And the sons of Bala were: Arud and Naaman, the family of Arud; Naaman, the family of Naaman.
26.41: These are the sons of Benyamin by their number: forty and five thousand and six hundred.
26.42: And the sons of Dan for their families: Shukham, the family of Shukham; these are the families of Dan for their families.
26.43: All the family of Shukham for their number: sixty and four thousand and four hundred.
26.44: And the sons of Ashir for their families: Yamna, the family of Yamna, Yashwa, the family of Yashwa, Yashwi, the family of Yashwi, Bria, the family of Bria.
26.45: And the sons of Bria: Kheber, the family of Kheber: Malkiel, the family of Malkiel.
26.46: And the name of the daughter of Ashir: Sarakh.
26.47: These are the families of the sons of Ashir by their number: fifty and three thousand and four hundred.
26.48: And the sons of Naphtali by their families: Nakhtsayel, the family of Nakhtsayel: Guni, the family of Guni.
26.49: Yatsar, the family of Yatsar: Shalim, the family of Shalim.
26.50: These are the families of the sons Naphtali for their families, and their number: forty and five thousand and four hundred.
26.51: All of the numbers of the sons of Israel: six hundred thousand and a thousand and seven hundred and thirty.
26.52: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
26.53: The land will be divided to these in the inheritance for the number of the names.
26.54: For many you will increase their inheritance, and for a few you shall diminish their inheritance; a man will receive his inheritance according to his number.
26.55: However the land will be divided in lots; they will inherit by the names of the families of their fathers.
26.56: An inheritance will be divided by the voice of lots among many to few.
26.57: And these are the numbers of Levi by their families: Gershun, the family of Gershun, Qahath, the family of Qahath, Merrari, the family of Merrari.
26.58: These are the families of Levi: the family of Lebni, the family of the Khebronites, the family of Makhli, the family of the Mushites, the family of Qorakh, and Qahath begot Amram.
26.59: And the name of the wife of Amram: Yukabar, daughter of Levi who was born to Levi in Egypt, and she bore to Amram, Ahron and Moshe and Maryam their sister.
26.60: And Nadab and Abihu and Eliazar and Ithamar were born to Ahron.
26.61: And Nadab and Abihu died when they brought strange fire before LORD JEHOVAH.
26.62: And the number of them was twenty and three thousand, every male from a son of a month and above, for they were not numbered within the children of Israel because an inheritance was not given to them among the children of Israel.
26.63: These were numbered by Moshe and by Eliazar the Priest who numbered the children of Israel in the plain of Moab by the Jordan of Yerikho.
26.64: And among these there was not a man of those numbered by Moshe or by Ahron the Priest, they who numbered the children of Israel in the wilderness of Sinai.
26.65: Because LORD JEHOVAH said to them, “Certainly they shall be killed in the wilderness and no man of them shall remain, except only Kalab, son of Yoophna, and Yeshua, son of Nun.”

27.1: And then came the daughters of Tsalphkhad, son of Khaphar, son of Gelad, son of Makir, son of Manasheh, from the family, of Menasheh, son of Yoseph; and these are the names of his daughters: Makhla and Yaa and Khagla and Melka and Tartsa.
27.2: And they stood before Moshe and before Eliazer the Priest and before the Princes and before all of the assembly in the door of the Time Tabernacle, and they were saying:
27.3: “Our father died in the wilderness and was not within the assembly that rose up in front of LORD JEHOVAH in the company of Qorakh, because he died in his sins; he had no sons.
27.4: Why is the name of our father blotted out from within his family because he has no son? Give us an inheritance among the brothers of our father.”
27.5: And Moshe brought their case before LORD JEHOVAH.
27.6: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe:
27.7: “The daughters of Tsalphkhad have spoken rightly; give to them a territory and an inheritance among the brothers of their fathers and establish to them the inheritance of their father.
27.8: And say to the children of Israel: ‘When a man will die and he has no son, give his inheritance to his daughter.
27.9: And if he has no daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers.
27.10: And if he has no brothers, give his inheritance to his father's brothers.
27.11: And if he has no father's brother, give his inheritance to one who is near to him from his family, and he shall inherit it; and it shall be for the children of Israel the law of justice, according to what LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.’”
27.12: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Go up to this mountain of the Hebrews and see the land of Canaan that I give to the children of Israel.
27.13: And see it and be gathered also to your people as Ahron your brother was gathered.
27.14: Because you provoked the Word of my mouth in the wilderness of Tsin in the strife of the assembly, and you did not sanctify me at the water in their sight; those are the waters of strife of Raqem in the wilderness of Tsin.”
27.15: And Moshe spoke before LORD JEHOVAH and said:
27.16: “Let LORD JEHOVAH, the God of the spirits of all flesh, order a man over the assembly.
27.17: To go out before them and to enter before them and bring them out and to bring them in, that the assembly of LORD JEHOVAH will not be as sheep that have no Shepherd.”
27.18: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe: “Take to yourself Yeshua, son of Nun, a man who has the Spirit in him and put your hand upon him.
27.19: And stand him before Eliazer the Priest and before all of the assembly and command him in their sight.
27.20: And put some of your glory upon him that all of the assembly of the children of Israel shall obey him.
27.21: And he shall stand before Eliazer the Priest and he shall be inquiring the law of petition for him before LORD JEHOVAH; by the word of his mouth he shall be going out and by the word of his mouth he shall be entering, he and all the children of Israel with him and all of the assembly.”
27.22: And Moshe did as LORD JEHOVAH commanded him, and he took Yeshua and presented him before Eliazer the Priest and before all of the assembly.
27.23: And he laid his hand upon him and he commanded him as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.

28.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
28.2: “Command the children of Israel and say to them that they shall be keeping and bringing to me in their times my offerings and the bread of my offerings and sweet savors.”
28.3: And say to them: “This is the gift that you shall be bringing to LORD JEHOVAH: lambs, sons of a year that have no flaw in them, two a day for a burning peace offering, constantly.
28.4: One lamb bring at dawn and another lamb bring at evening.
28.5: And one tenth of an ephah of fine flour as an offering mixed with pressed oil, a fourth of a hin.
28.6: A burning peace offering constantly that was made in the mountain of Sinai for a sweet fragrance of savor, a gift to LORD JEHOVAH.
28.7: And a drink offering of wine, a fourth of a hin for one lamb will be poured out in the holy place, a drink offering that is aged before LORD JEHOVAH.
28.8: And offer another lamb at evening like the offering of dawn, and like the drink offering, offer an offering for a sweet fragrance savor to LORD JEHOVAH.
28.9: And on the day of the Sabbath, two lambs, the offspring of a year that have no flaw in them, and two tenths an ephah fine flour, of an offering mixed with oil and its drink offering:
28.10: A burning peace offering of the Sabbath, on the Sabbath, for a burning peace offering constantly, and its drink offering.
28.11: On the first of your months bring burning peace offerings to LORD JEHOVAH, two bulls, sons of a herd, and one ram and seven lambs, male offspring of a year that have no flaw in them;
28.12: And three tenths ephah fine flour of an offering mixed with oil for one ox and two tenths fine flour mixed with oil for one ram;
28.13: And onetenth fine flour of an offering mixed with oil to LORD JEHOVAH, one burning peace offering for a sweet fragrance savor to LORD JEHOVAH.
28.14: And their drink offerings of wine shall be a half of a hin with an ox and a third of a hin shall be with a ram and a fourth of a hin shall be with a lamb; this is the burning peace offering of the first of the months in all the months of the year.
28.15: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins to LORD JEHOVAH for a burning peace offering is made constantly, and a drink offering.
28.16: And on the fourteenth of the first month is Passover to LORD JEHOVAH.
28.17: And in the fifteenth in the month, the feast of unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days.
28.18: The first day is announced and holy and you shall do no work of labor:
28.19: And bring burning peace offerings to LORD JEHOVAH, two bulls, sons of a herd, and one ram and seven lambs, sons of a year that have no flaw in them, they shall be yours:
28.20: And their offerings: three tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil with an ox, and two tenths you shall make with a ram;
28.21: And onetenth with one lamb, so do with their seven lambs.
28.22: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins to atone for you.
28.23: Outside of the burning peace offering of dawn you shall make a burning peace offering constantly.
28.24: Be doing these every day for seven days, an offering of bread for a sweet fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH for a burning peace offering; it shall be made and its drink offering constantly.
28.25: And the seventh day shall be announced and holy to you and you shall do no work of labor.
28.26: And in the day of first fruits when you bring a meal offering from the new to LORD JEHOVAH in your weeks, it shall be announced and holy to you, and you shall do no work of labor:
28.27: And bring burning peace offerings for a sweet fragrance savor to LORD JEHOVAH: two bulls, offspring of a herd, and one ram and seven lambs, males of a year;
28.28: And their offerings, three tenths of an ephah fine flour mixed with oil with one bull and two tenths of an ephah with one ram:
28.29: And one tenth of an ephah for one lamb, thus for the seven lambs;
28.30: And one kid of goats to atone for you.
28.31: Be offering apart from the constant burning peace offering and its meal offering that have no flaw in them, and their drink offering.”

29.1: "And it shall be proclaimed and holy to you on the first of the month in the seventh month, and you shall do no work of labor; it shall be to you a day of sounding trumpets.
29.2: And make a burning peace offering for a fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH, one bull, son of a herd, one ram and seven lambs, males of a year that have no flaw in them:
29.3: And their offerings, three tenths fine flour mixed with oil with one ox, and two tenths with one ram,
29.4: And one tenth with one lamb, so for their seven lambs,
29.5: And one kid of goats for sin to atone for you:
29.6: Apart from the burning peace offering of the first month and the burning peace meal offering constantly, and their meal offerings and their drink offerings, according to their portion for a sweet savor, a gift to LORD JEHOVAH.
29.7: And the tenth of this seventh month shall be proclaimed and holy to you and you shall do no work of labor:
29.8: And bring a burning peace offering to LORD JEHOVAH for a fragrance of savor: one bull, son of a herd, and one ram, and seven lambs, males of a year that have no flaw in them:
29.9: And their offerings of fine flour mixed with oil, three tenths with an ox and two tenths with a ram,
29.10: And onetenth with one lamb, the same for the seven lambs:
29.11: One kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from the burning offering of atonement, the continual burning peace offering and their meal offering and their drink offering.
29.12: And the fifteenth in this, the seventh month, shall be proclaimed and holy to you and you shall do no work of labor, and make a feast to LORD JEHOVAH for seven days:
29.13: And bring a burning peace offering, a gift for a fragrance of savor to LORD JEHOVAH: thirteen bulls, sons of a herd, and two rams and fourteen lambs males of a year that have no flaw in them:
29.14: And their offering of threetenths fine flour mixed with oil with one ox; so with the thirteen oxen and two tenths with one ram, so with the two rams,
29.15: And one tenth with one lamb, in the same way for the fourteen lambs:
29.16: And one kid of goats for sin apart from the continual burning peace offering and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.17: And in the second day, twelve bulls, the offspring of a herd, and two rams and fourteen lambs, males of a year that have no flaw in them:
29.18: And their meal offering and their drink offering of oxen and of rams and of lambs, by their number, according to their portion:
29.19: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.20: And in the third day, eleven bulls and two rams and fourteen lambs, males of a year that have no flaw in them;
29.21: And their meal offering and their drink offering of an ox and of a ram and of a lamb, by their number, according to their portion:
29.22: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.23: And in the fourth day, ten bulls and two rams and fourteen lambs, sons of a year, that have no flaw in them:
29.24: And their meal offering and their drink offering of an ox and of a ram and of a lamb, by their number, according to their portion:
29.25: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.26: And in the fifth day, nine bulls and two rams and fourteen lambs, sons of a year, that have no flaw in them:
29.27: And their meal offering and their drink offering of an ox and of a ram and of a lamb, by their number, according to their portion:
29.28: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.29: And in the sixth day, eight bulls and two rams and fourteen lambs, sons of a year, that have no flaw in them:
29.30: And their meal offering and their drink offering of an ox and of a ram and of a lamb, by their number, according to their portion:
29.31: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.32: And in the seventh day, seven bulls and two rams and fourteen lambs, males of a year, that have no flaw in them:
29.33: And their meal offering and their drink offering of an ox and of a ram and of a lamb, by their number, according to their portion:
29.34: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.35: And in the eighth day be assembled and you shall not do any work of labor:
29.36: And bring burning peace offerings, an offering for a sweet fragrance savor to LORD JEHOVAH: one bull of a herd and one ram, and four lambs, sons of a year that have no flaw in them:
29.37: And their meal offering and their drink offering of an ox and of a ram and of a lamb, by their number, according to their portion:
29.38: And one kid of goats for the sake of sins, apart from continual burning peace offerings and its meal offering and its drink offering.
29.39: These things be performing to LORD JEHOVAH in the time of your feasts apart from your vows and apart from your devotion offerings and your burning peace offerings and your meal offerings and your drink offerings and your gifts.”
29.40: And Moshe said to the children of Israel all that LORD JEHOVAH had commanded Moshe.

30.1: And Moshe spoke with the Leaders of the tribes of the children of Israel and said to them: “This is the word that LORD JEHOVAH commanded:
30.2: ‘When a man will vow a vow to LORD JEHOVAH and will swear in an oath and will bind a bond on himself, he shall not violate his word; everything that proceeds from his mouth he shall do.
30.3: And when a woman will vow a vow to LORD JEHOVAH and she shall bind a bond on herself in her youth in the house of her father:
30.4: And her father will hear the vow and the bond that she bound on herself and her father shall be silent to her, all of the vows and all the bonds that she bound on herself shall be confirmed.
30.5: And if her father would nullify them in the day when he hears all the vows and all the bonds that she bound on herself, they shall not be confirmed and LORD JEHOVAH shall forgive her because her father nullified them.
30.6: And if she will belong to a husband and her vows are upon her or a devoted offering of her lips that she bound on herself;
30.7: And her husband will hear, and he is silent to her in the day when he hears, all of the vows and the bonds that she bound on herself shall certainly be confirmed.
30.8: And if in the day when her husband hears, he nullifies them, the vows and the devotion offerings of her lips that she bound on herself shall be void and LORD JEHOVAH shall forgive her.
30.9: And the entire vow of a widow or of an abandoned woman that she binds on herself will be confirmed for her.
30.10: And if she has vowed in the house of her husband or she has bound a bond on herself in an oath;
30.11: And her husband will hear and he is silent to her and he does not nullify them, all of the vows and all the bonds that she bound on herself shall surely be confirmed.
30.12: And if her husband would certainly nullify them in the day when he hears everything that goes out from her lips, her vow and the bond that she bound on herself shall not be established because her husband nullified them and LORD JEHOVAH shall forgive her.
30.13: Her husband may confirm all of the vows and all the oaths of bonds that detract from the soul, or her husband may nullify them.
30.14: And if her husband will be intentionally quiet to her from day to day, all of the vows and all bonds that she bound on herself shall be confirmed, because her husband was silent to her in the day when he heard.
30.15: And if he will certainly nullify them after he hears, he will bear her sin.’”
30.16: These are the laws that LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe between a man and his wife and the house of a father and his daughter in her youth, in the house of her father.

31.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
31.2: “Be avenged with the vengeance of the children of Israel from the Midianites and then you shall be gathered to your people.”
31.3: And Moshe said to the people: “Arm some of your men for the army and they shall be against the Midianites and they shall avenge the vengeance of LORD JEHOVAH from the Midianites.
31.4: Send one thousand from a tribe of all of the tribes of the children of Israel into the army.
31.5: And they chose a thousand from the tribes of the sons of Israel, a thousand from a tribe, twelve thousand armed in the army.
31.6: And Moshe sent them one thousand from a tribe, twelve thousands who armed themselves, and Phinekhas, son of Eliazer the Priest, in the army, and articles of holiness and trumpets to blow in his hand.
31.7: And they were strengthened against Midian, as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe, and they killed every male.
31.8: And they killed the Kings of Midian with their slain: Avi and Raqem and Tsur and Khur and Raba, five Kings, Midianites, and they killed Balaam, son of Beor, with a sword.
31.9: And the sons of Israel took the women of Midian and their little ones captive and they plundered all their livestock and all their possessions and all their wealth.
31.10: And all the towns of the place of their dwelling and all their fields they burned in fire.
31.11: And they led all the captivity and all of the daughters of the children of men and of the domestic animals.
31.12: And they brought the captivity and the prey and the plunder to Moshe and to Eliazer the Priest and to all of the assembly of the children of Israel to the encampment on the plain of Moab by the Jordan of Yerikho.
31.13: And Moshe and Eliazar the Priest and all the Princes of the assembly went out to meet them outside of the camp.
31.14: And Moshe was angry against the Commanders of the army, the Leaders of thousands and Captains of hundreds who came from the army of war.
31.15: And Moshe said to them, “Why have you saved all the females?
31.16: For these were a subversion to the sons of Israel by the word of Balaam and they provoked and caused evil against LORD JEHOVAH in the matter of Peor, and it was a sudden plague in the assembly of LORD JEHOVAH.
31.17: Now kill all of the boys of the males and kill every woman who has known sexual relations of males.
31.18: And every female child of women that has not known sexual relations of males save for yourselves.
31.19: But you dwell outside of the camp seven days; everyone who kills a person and everyone who approaches one killed, sprinkle upon him in the third day and in the seventh day, you and your captives.
31.20: And sprinkle upon all cloaks and all garments of leather and every product of hair and every article of wood.”
31.21: And Eliazer the Priest told the men of the army who came from this war the commandment of the law that LORD JEHOVAH had commanded to Moshe;
31.22: “However gold and silver and brass and iron and tin and lead.
31.23: And everything that enters the furnace, pass it through the fire and it shall be purified, and sprinkle the water of sprinkling upon it and immerse all that has not passed through the fire in water.
31.24: And purify your garments on the seventh day and you shall be purified, and after that you shall enter the encampment.”
31.25: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
31.26: “Take a count of the prey and of the captives of the children of men and of the animals, you and Eliazar the Priest and the Chiefs of the fathers of the assembly:
31.27: And divide the prey among the men, the makers of war who went out in the army and among all of the assembly:
31.28: And set apart a tax to LORD JEHOVAH from the men, the makers of war who went out in the army and from all of the assembly: one soul of fifty of the children of men and of oxen and of donkeys and of sheep:
31.29: And from their half take and give to Eliazer the Priest a gift of LORD JEHOVAH.
31.30: And from the half of the children of Israel take one of fifty from the men and from the donkeys and from bulls and from the sheep and from all domestic animals, and give them to the Levites who keep the watch of the Tabernacle of LORD JEHOVAH.”
31.31: And Moshe and Eliazar the Priest did as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.
31.32: And there were six hundred and seventy and five thousand sheep of the prey and the captives that the people and the army plundered,
31.33: And bulls, seventy and two thousand,
31.34: And donkeys, sixty and one thousand,
31.35: And souls of people of the women who did not know sexual relations of males, all the souls, thirty and two thousand.
31.36: And the division in the portion of those who had gone into the army was: sheep, three hundred and thirty and seven thousand and five hundred:
31.37: And the tax for LORD JEHOVAH from the sheep was six thousand and seven hundred and fifty.
31.38: And oxen, thirty and six thousand, and their tax to LORD JEHOVAH: seven hundred and twenty.
31.39: And donkeys, thirty thousand and five hundred, and their tax to LORD JEHOVAH: six hundred and ten.
31.40: And the souls of men, sixteen thousand, and their tax to LORD JEHOVAH: three hundred and twenty souls.
31.41: And Moshe gave the money of the gift of LORD JEHOVAH to Eliazer the Priest as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.
31.42: From the half of the children of Israel that Moshe divided to them, of the men that had gone into the army,
31.43: And the division of the assembly of the sheep was three hundred and thirty and seven thousand and five hundred,
31.44: And bulls, thirty and six thousand,
31.45: And donkeys, thirty thousand and five hundred,
31.46: And the souls of men, sixteen thousand.
31.47: And Moshe took from the half of the children Israel, one of fifty of the children of men, and from beasts, and he gave them to the Levites who keep guard of the Tabernacle of LORD JEHOVAH, as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe.
31.48: And the men who were put in charge over a thousand of the army approached to Moshe, Leaders of a thousand and Leaders of a hundred:
31.49: And they said to Moshe: “Your Servants took a count of the army of men, the makers of war of our people, and no man of us is lacking.
31.50: And we bring the offering of LORD JEHOVAH, each man who finds articles of gold, anklets and bracelets and rings and earrings and necklaces, to atone for our souls before LORD JEHOVAH.”
31.51: And Moshe and Eliazar the Priest took the gold from them, all articles that are made.
31.52: And all the gold of the offering that was offered to LORD JEHOVAH was sixteen thousand and seven hundred and fifty shekels from the Chiefs of thousands and from the Chiefs of hundreds.
31.53: But the men of the army plundered them, each man for himself.
31.54: And Moshe and Eliazar the Priest took gold from the Heads of thousands and from the Heads of hundreds and they brought it to the Time Tabernacle as a memorial for the children of Israel before LORD JEHOVAH.

32.1: And great herds belonged to the children of Rubil and to the children of Gad, and they were very strong, and they saw Yazir and the land of Gelad as a place to go graze herds;
32.2: And the children of Rubil and the children of Gad came and they said to Moshe and to Eliazar the Priest and to the Princes of the assembly:
32.3: Atruth and Ribun and Yazir and Namra and Khesbun and Alala and Sheba and Nebo and Baun,
32.4: The land that LORD JEHOVAH put to the sword before the children of Israel, the land that is where to go for the pasture of cattle, and your Servants have cattle”:
32.5: And they said, “If we find favor before you, let this land be given to your Servants as an inheritance, and do not bring us over the Jordan.”
32.6: And Moshe said to the children of Rubil and to the children of Gad, “Your brethren are going out for battle and you are dwelling here?
32.7: Why do you break the heart of the children of Israel that they should not pass over to the land that LORD JEHOVAH gives to them?
32.8: Your fathers did so when I sent them from Reqem of Gia to spy out the land.
32.9: And they came up unto the valley of Segula and they saw the land and they broke the heart of the children of Israel that they would not enter the land that LORD JEHOVAH gave to them.
32.10: And the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH was provoked against them in that day and he swore and said:
32.11: ‘The men who came up from Egypt from a son of twenty years and above shall not see the land that I swore to Abraham and to Isaac and to Yaquuv, because they have not followed wholly after me:
32.12: But only Kalab son of Yoophna the Qenezite and Yeshua son of Nun have followed wholly after LORD JEHOVAH.’
32.13: And the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH was provoked against Israel and he made them wander in the wilderness forty years until all the generation of the men who had done evil before LORD JEHOVAH came to an end.
32.14: And behold, you are risen, even you today, in the place of your fathers, a generation of men who are sinners, for you will increase again the wrath of LORD JEHOVAH against Israel.
32.15: And if you turn from LORD JEHOVAH, He will increase again your wandering in the wilderness, and for this you are destroying all the people.”
32.16: And they came to him and they said, “We will build pens of sheep for our livestock here and towns for our little ones:
32.17: And we shall be equipped and we shall go before the children of Israel until we shall bring them to their country and our little ones will dwell in the mighty cities from before the inhabitants of the land.
32.18: We will not return to our houses until the children of Israel inherit, each man, his inheritance.
32.19: And we will not inherit with them from the crossing of Jordan and beyond, because we receive our inheritance from the crossing of Jordan from the East.”
32.20: And Moshe said to them, “If you make this answer, also equip yourselves before LORD JEHOVAH for battle,
32.21: And all of you pass over the Jordan when you are equipped for battle before LORD JEHOVAH until He will destroy his enemies before Him,
32.22: And the land will be subdued before LORD JEHOVAH then, and you will return and you will be declared guiltless by LORD JEHOVAH and by Israel, and you shall have this land for an inheritance before LORD JEHOVAH.
32.23: And if you do not so, you sin against LORD JEHOVAH, and know that your sins track you down.
32.24: Build for yourselves cities for your little ones and pens for your flocks, and anything that goes out from your mouth, do.
32.25: And the children of Rubil and the children of Gad said to Moshe: “Your Servants shall do as our Lord commanded.
32.26: Our little ones and our women and our livestock and all our animals shall be in the villages of Gelad:
32.27: And your Servants shall pass over when they are equipped in the army before LORD JEHOVAH for battle, as our Lord said.”
32.28: And Moshe commanded Eliazer the Priest and Yeshua son of Nun and the Leaders of the tribes of the fathers of the children of Israel concerning all of them:
32.29: And Moshe said to them: “If the children of Rubil and the children of Gad pass over the Jordan with you when they are equipped before LORD JEHOVAH for battle and the land will be subdued before you, the land of Gelad will be given to them as an inheritance:
32.30: And if they shall not pass over with you when they are equipped, they will inherit with you in the land of Canaan.”
32.31: And the children of Rubil and the children of Gad answered and they said to Moshe: “As LORD JEHOVAH said to your Servants, thus we shall do.
32.32: We shall pass over when equipped before LORD JEHOVAH for battle to the land of Canaan and the possession of our inheritance at the crossing of Jordan.”
32.33: And Moshe gave to the children of Rubil and to the children of Gad and to half of the tribe of Menasheh, son of Yoseph, the Kingdom of Sikhon the King of the Amorites, and the Kingdom of Og the King of Mathnin, all the land and its cities at its borders and the cities of the land that are around it.
32.34: And the children of Gad built up Ribon and Atruth and Aduir,
32.35: And Atruth, Shuphan and Yazir and Yabegha,
32.36: And Bayth Namra, and Bayth Haran fortified cities and pens of sheep.
32.37: And the sons of Rubil built Kheshbon and Elala and Quryathim,
32.38: And Nabu and Belmun whose names were adopted, and Sebma, and they called their names for names of cities that they built.
32.39: And the sons of Mekir, son of Menasheh, went to Gelad and subjected it and destroyed the Amorites who were in it.
32.40: And Moshe gave Gelad to Mekir, son of Menasheh, and he dwelt in it.
32.41: And Yair, son of Menasheh, went and conquered their villages and he called them Capharunay d’Yair –“Hamlets of Yair” until today.
32.42: And Nekakh went and conquered Qith and its villages and he called it by the name Nekakh.

33.1: And these are the journeys of the children of Israel when they had gone out from the land of Egypt with their armies by the hand of Moshe and of Ahron.
33.2: And Moshe wrote their goings out and their picking up camps, by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH, and these are their picking up camps and their goings out.
33.3: And they picked up from Ramsis on the fifteenth in the first month after Passover. The children of Israel went out from Egypt by a high hand before the eyes of all the Egyptians.
33.4: And the Egyptians were burying the firstborn ones whom LORD JEHOVAH killed among them, and LORD JEHOVAH executed judgment on their gods.
33.5: And the children of Israel picked up from Raamsis and camped in Saquth.
33.6: And they picked up from Saquth and they camped in Atham that is in the ends of the wilderness.
33.7: And they picked up from Atham and camped on the mouth of Kheritha before Baaltsphun, and they camped before Magdul.
33.8: And they picked up from the mouth of Kharitha and they went within the sea to the wilderness and they went three day’s journey in the wilderness of Atham and camped in Murath.
33.9: And they picked up from Murath and they came to Alim, and in Alim there were twelve fountains of waters and seventy palm trees, and they camped there by the water.
33.10: And they picked up from Alim and they camped on the side of the Sea of Reeds.
33.11: And they picked up from beside the Sea of Reeds and they camped in the wilderness of Sin.
33.12: And they picked up from the wilderness of Sin and they camped in Raphqa[Rebecca].
33.13: And they picked up from RaphqaRebecca and they camped in Alush.
33.14: And they picked up from Alush and they camped in Raphidin, and there were no waters there for the people that they may drink.
33.15: And they picked up from Raphidin and they camped in the wilderness of Sinai.
33.16: And they picked up from the wilderness of Sinai and they camped in Qabrey D'Ragya –“Graves of Lusting”
33.17: And they picked up from Qabrey D'Ragya Regta – “Graves of Lusting Lust” and they camped in Khetsruth.
33.18: And they picked up from Khetsruth and they camped in Rethma.
33.19: And they picked up from Rethma and they camped in Ramun Pharets.
33.20: And they picked up from Ramun Pharets and they camped in Lebna.
33.21: And they picked up from Lebna and they camped in Rasa.
33.22: And they picked up from Rasa and they camped in Qahlath.
33.23: And they picked up from Qahlath and they camped in the mountain of Shaphar.
33.24: And they picked up from the mountain of Shaphar and they camped in Khadda.
33.25: And they picked up from Khadda and they camped in Maqhaluth.
33.26: And they picked up from Maqhaluth and they camped in Takhath.
33.27: And they picked up from Takhath and they camped in Tarakh.
33.28: And they picked up from Tarakh and they camped in Methqa.
33.29: And they picked up from Methqa and they camped in Khashmuna.
33.30: And they picked up from Khashmuna and they camped in Masruth.
33.31: And they picked up from Masruth and they camped in Benay Yaqan.
33.32: And they picked up from Benay Yaqan and they camped in Khadgadgad.
33.33: And they picked up from Khadgadgad and they camped in Yatbath.
33.34: And they picked up from Yatbath and they camped in Akruna.
33.35: And they picked up from Akruna and they camped in ItsinuGebar.
33.36: And they picked up from ItsinuGebar and they camped in the wilderness of Tsin that is Qedesh.
33.37: And they picked up from Qedesh and they camped in Hur Mountain that is in the ends of the land of Adum.
33.38: And Ahron the Priest came up to Hur Mountain by the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH and he died there in the fortieth year that the children of Israel had gone from the land of Egypt, in the first month in the first of the month.
33.39: And Ahron was son of a hundred and twenty and three years when he died in Hur Mountain.
33.40: And the Canaanite King of Gadar who dwelt in the south in the land of Canaan heard when the children of Israel came.
33.41: And they picked up from Hur Mountain and they camped in Tsalmuna.
33.42: And they picked up from Tsalmuna and they camped in Pinun.
33.43: And they picked up from Pinun and they camped in Abuth.
33.44: And they picked up from Abuth and they camped in Ayna D'Ebria in the borders of Moab.
33.45: And they picked up from Ayna D'Ebria and they camped in Ribun Gad.
33.46: And they picked up from Ribun Gad and they camped in Balmun Deblathim.
33.47: And they picked up from Balmun Deblathim and they camped in the Mountain of the Hebrews that is before Nabu.
33.48: And they picked up from the Mountain of the Hebrews and they camped in the plain of Moab that is by the Jordan of Yerikho.
33.49: And they camped on the Jordan from Bayth Ashimun and unto Abal of Satim that is in the plain of Moab.
33.50: And LORD JEHOVAH said to Moshe in the plain of Moab that is by the Jordan of Yerikho:
33.51: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them, ‘You are passing over the Jordan to the land of Canaan;
33.52: And you shall destroy all of the inhabitants of the land from before you and you shall destroy all their idols and throw away all the images of their forging, and all their high places you shall pull down:
33.53: And you shall inherit the land and you shall dwell in it because I have given the land to you to inherit it.
33.54: And possess the land in the allotted portions of your families; you shall increase the inheritance for the large and you shall diminish the inheritance for the small, for whatever portion is allotted for the tribe of their fathers they shall inherit.
33.55: And if you do not destroy the inhabitants of the land from before you, those who are left of them shall be splinters in your eyes and spear heads in your sides, and they will distress you in the land where you inhabit it.
33.56: And just as I planned to do to them I shall do to you.’”

34.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
34.2: “Command the children of Israel and say to them: ‘You are entering the land of Canaan; this land will be divided to you for an inheritance, the land of Canaan in its borders:
34.3: And the side of the south from the wilderness of Tsin on the border of Adum will be for you, and the border of the south from the end of the Sea of Salt from the East will be for you:
34.4: And your border will be going around from the south to the ascent of Sapharvim and will be passing to Tsin, and its limits shall be from the south to Raqem D'Gaya and it will go forth to Khatsar Edar, and it shall go through to Atsmun:
34.5: And the border shall turn from Atsmun to the river of Egypt, and its limits shall be to the sea.
34.6: And the border of the sea shall be yours, the Great Sea and its border, this shall be your border of the sea.
34.7: And this shall be your border of the north, and from the Great Sea you shall mark out for you to Hur Mountain:
34.8: And from Hur Mountain you shall mark out to the entrance of Khamath and they shall be the limits of the borders to Tsadad:
34.9: And the border will be going out to Zaphrun and its limits shall be to Khatsar Aynan; these shall be your borders of the north.
34.10: And you shall mark out your borders of the east from Khatsar Aynan to Shapham:
34.11: And the border from Shapham to Deblath from the east to Ayn will be going down and the border will be going down and will be touching the side of the Sea of Kenarath from the East:
34.12: And the border will be going down to the Jordan and its limits shall be to the Salt Sea; this will be your land with its borders all around.’”
34.13: And Moshe commanded the children of Israel and said to them, “This is the land that you will divide into portions that LORD JEHOVAH commanded to give to the nine tribes and to the half tribe:
34.14: Because the tribe of the children of Rubil have taken, with the house of their fathers and the tribe of the children of Gad, with the house of their fathers and the half of the tribe of Menasheh, they have received their inheritance:
34.15: Two tribes and half a tribe received their inheritance from the crossing of Jordan of Yerikho, adjoining there from the east.”
34.16: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
34.17: “These are the names of the men who distribute the inheritance land to you: Eliazer Priest and Yeshua son of Nun.
34.18: And take one Prince from each tribe that they will distribute the land to you.”
34.19: And these are the names of the Princes: of the men from the tribe of Yehuda, Kalab son of Yuphana.
34.20: From the tribe of Shemon, Shlamwayel son of Amihud.
34.21: From the tribe of Benyamin, Eldad son of Kaslun.
34.22: From the tribe of Dan, Beqi son of Igli.
34.23: From the tribe of Yoseph of the tribe of Menasheh, Nakhlayel son of Aphun.
34.24: From the tribe of Aphreim, Qemuyel son of Shaphtan.
34.25: From the tribe of Zebulon, Elitsaphan son of Parnak.
34.26: From the tribe of Issakar, Petayel son of Azor.
34.27: From the tribe of Ashayr, Akhihud son of Shlumi.
34.28: From the tribe of Naphtali, Pedayel son of Amihud.
34.29: LORD JEHOVAH commanded these to distribute the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.

35.1: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe in the plain of Moab that is on the Jordan of Yerikho and said to him:
35.2: “Command the children of Israel and they shall give towns to inhabit to the Levites from the inheritance of their possession and they shall give fields of the towns in their surroundings to the Levites.
35.3: And they shall have cities to inhabit and their fields shall be for their livestock and for their cattle and for all their beasts.
35.4: And the fields of the villages that you will give to the Levites are from the wall of the city and outward, one thousand cubits as a circle.
35.5: And measure from outside the city to the side of the east, two thousand cubits, and to the side of the south two thousand cubits, and to the side of the west two thousand cubits, and to the side of the north two thousand cubits, and the city in the midst; this shall be the open space of the city for you.
35.6: And cities that you are giving to the Levites, let six cities be a place of refuge for you, so that a killer who kills his neighbor without his intention may flee there, and add forty and two cities unto them.
35.7: All the cities that you are giving to the Levites are forty and eight cities, those and their open spaces.
35.8: And the cities that you are giving from the inheritance of the children of Israel, from the many you shall give more, and from the few you shall give less; a man will give from his cities to the Levites according to the proportion of the inheritance that he possesses.”
35.9: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with Moshe and said to him:
35.10: “Speak with the children of Israel and say to them, ‘When you have crossed the Jordan to the land of Canaan.
35.11: Prepare for yourselves cities to be a place of refuge for you that a killer, whoever may kill a soul by accident, may escape there.
35.12: And these cities shall be yours for a house of refuge from one seeking the vengeance of blood, and a killer will not be killed until standing in front of the assembly in judgment.
35.13: And the cities that you are giving shall be the six cities of a place of refuge for you.
35.14: Give three cities at the crossing of Jordan and give three cities in the land of Canaan; the cities of the place of refuge shall be.
35.15: For the children of Israel, and those who are converted to me and those who dwell among you and these six cities shall be a place of refuge for you, so that anyone who kills a soul by accident may escape to them.
35.16: And if he struck him with an implement of iron so that he would die, and he died, he is a murderer; that murderer certainly shall be killed.
35.17: And if he struck him with a stone in the hand so that he should die, and he died, he is a murderer; he shall certainly be killed.
35.18: And if he struck him with an implement of wood in the hand so that he should die, and he died, he is a murderer; he shall certainly be killed.
35.19: The seeker of vengeance of blood shall kill the murderer when he meets him.
35.20: And if he struck him with hatred or throws at him by treachery and he died, he is a murderer;
35.21: With hatred he struck him with his hand so that he should die, and he died; he is a murderer; he shall certainly be killed; the seeker of vengeance of blood shall kill the murderer when he meets him.
35.22: And if he struck him suddenly without hatred or threw at him any implement without treachery.
35.23: Or he threw any stone upon him that kills, when he did not see, and he died, and was not his enemy and was not seeking his harm:
35.24: The assembly shall judge between the killer and the seeker of the vengeance of blood by these judgments:
35.25: And the assembly shall save the killer from the seeker of vengeance of blood and the assembly shall send him to a city of refuge where he had fled to it and he shall dwell in it until the Great Priest will die who is anointed with the oil of Holiness.
35.26: And if a killer will come forth outside of the borders of the city of refuge to which he fled;
35.27: And the seeker of vengeance of blood will find him outside of the borders of the city of refuge and the seeker of vengeance of blood will kill the killer, there is no penalty to him for bloodshed:
35.28: Because this one should dwell in the city of refuge until the Great Priest would die, and when the Great Priest has died, the killer will return to the land of his inheritance.
35.29: And these laws shall be for you to eternity for your generations in every place of your habitations.
35.30: Everyone who will kill a person, the murderer will be killed through the mouth of witnesses, and one witness shall not testify against a soul that he would be put to death.
35.31: And you shall not receive a bribe for the person of a killer who is condemned to death, but he shall certainly be killed.
35.32: And you shall not accept a bribe that he may flee to a city of refuge and go and dwell in the land until the Great Priest would die.
35.33: And you shall not defile the land in which you dwell, because blood defiles the land, and the land where blood is shed will not be spared for it unless the blood of him who shed it is shed in it.
35.34: And you shall not defile the land in which you dwell, for I camp within it, because I AM LORD JEHOVAH, for I camp among the children of Israel.’”

36.1: And the head fathers of the family of the children of Gelad, son of Makir, son of Manasheh, from the family of Menasheh, son of Yoseph, approached and they spoke before Moshe and before Eliazer the Priest and before the Princes of the assembly, the Heads of the fathers of the children of Israel:
36.2: And they said, “LORD JEHOVAH commanded our Lord to give the land for an inheritance by lots to the children of Israel, and our Lord had been commanded from LORD JEHOVAH to give the inheritance of Tsalphkhad our brother to his daughters.
36.3: And if they will be wives to another of the tribes of the children of Israel, their inheritance will be subtracted from the inheritance of their fathers and will be added on to the inheritance of the tribes that will marry them and it will be subtracted from the portion of our inheritance.
36.4: And if there shall be a restitution for the children of Israel, their inheritance will be added to the inheritance of the tribes that will have them, and their inheritance will be subtracted from the inheritance of the tribes of their fathers.”
36.5: And Moshe commanded the children of Israel from the word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH and said: “The tribe of the children of Yoseph is speaking justly.
36.6: This answer LORD JEHOVAH commanded concerning the daughters of Tsalphkhad and said, ‘To whomever is pleasing in their eyes let them be wives, however let them belong to the tribe of the family of their fathers.
36.7: And the inheritance of the children of Israel shall not go around from tribe to another tribe, but each man of the children of Israel shall cleave to the inheritance of the tribe of his father.
36.8: And every daughter who inherits an inheritance from a tribe of the children of Israel, she will be a wife for one of the family of the tribe of her father, that the children of Israel, each man, may inherit the inheritance of his fathers.
36.9: And an inheritance shall not go around from tribe to another tribe, but a man shall be joined by his inheritance to the tribes of the children Israel.”
36.10: And as LORD JEHOVAH commanded Moshe, thus the daughters of Tsalphkhad did:
36.11: And Makhla and Tartsa and Khagla and Melka and Yaa, the daughters of Tsalphkhad, were married to the sons of their father's brothers:
36.12: They were wives to families of the children of Manasheh, son of Yoseph, and their inheritance was by the tribe of the family of their father.
36.13: These are the commandments and the laws and judgments that LORD JEHOVAH commanded by the agency of Moshe for the children of Israel in the plain of Moab by the Jordan of Yerikho.

1.1: And these are the words that Moshe said to all Israel at the crossing of Jordan in the wilderness opposite the Reed Sea between Paran and Taphel and Lebanon and Khatsruth and Rizahab.
1.2: A journey of eleven days from Khoreeb to the mountain of Seir and unto Raqem of Gaya.
1.3: And it was in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, in the first of the month, Moshe spoke with the children of Israel everything that LORD JEHOVAH had commanded him concerning them;
1.4: After he had killed Sihon, the King of the Amorites, who was dwelling in Kheshbon, and Og, the King of Mathnin, who was dwelling in Astruth and in Ardi:
1.5: Moshe camped at the crossing of Jordan in the land of Moab; he explained this Law and said:
1.6: “LORD JEHOVAH our God said to us in Khoreeb, ‘It has been long for you that you have dwelt in this mountain:
1.7: Return and pick yourselves up and enter to the mountain of the Amorites and into all its surroundings, to Arabah and to the mountain and to the lowland and to the south and the shores of the sea, the land of the Canaanites and Lebanon, unto the great river, the river Euphrates.
1.8: See, I have given the land before you; enter and possess the land that LORD JEHOVAH swore to your fathers, to Abraham and to Isaac and to Yaquuv, to give to them and to their seed after them.’
1.9: And I said to you at that time, ‘I alone am not able to bear you:
1.10: LORD JEHOVAH your God has multiplied you and you are today a multitude like the stars that are in the sky.
1.11: LORD JEHOVAH, the God of your fathers, will add to you your equal a thousand times and will bless you just as He said to you.
1.12: How therefore can I alone carry your baggage and your cargo and your legal cases?
1.13: Choose men for you that are wise and are understanding and known with your tribes, and I shall confirm them as your Leaders.’
1.14: And you answered and you said to me: ‘The word that you said to do is good.’
1.15: And I brought the Chiefs of your tribes, wise and knowledgeable men and I have made them Leaders over you: Heads of a thousand, and Heads of a hundred, and Heads of fifty, and Heads of ten, and the Scribes for your tribes.
1.16: And I ordered your Judges at that time and I said to them: ‘Be listening among your brethren and judging the truth between a man and his brother and his guest.
1.17: Do not accept persons in judgment; listen to the small like the great; you shall not be afraid before a man, because judgment is of God, and the matter that is hard for you, bring to me, and I shall hear it.’
1.18: And I commanded you at that time every matter that you should do.
1.19: And we moved from Khoreeb and we traveled in that entire great and awesome wilderness that you saw in the land of the mountain of the Amorites, as LORD JEHOVAH our God commanded us, and we came unto Raqem D'Gaya.
1.20: And I said to you: ‘You have come unto a mountain of the Amorites that LORD JEHOVAH our God gave to us.
1.21: See that LORD JEHOVAH your God gives the land in front of you; go up and possess the land, just as LORD JEHOVAH God of your fathers said to you; you shall not be afraid and you shall not be alarmed.’
1.22: And you came near to me, all of you, and you said: ‘We will send men before us; they will spy the land for us and they will give us a statement and they will show us the way to go into it and the towns to enter.’
1.23: And the answer was good in my eyes, and I brought twelve men of you, each man from a tribe:
1.24: And they turned and came up to the mountain and they came up unto the valley of Segula and they spied out the land.
1.25: And they took some fruit of the land with their hands and they brought it to us and they gave us a statement and they said: ‘To us the land is good that LORD JEHOVAH our God gives us.’
1.26: And you were not willing to go up but you provoked the Word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH our God to wrath:
1.27: And you murmured from your tents and you said, ‘Because LORD JEHOVAH hates us, He brought us out from the land of Egypt to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, that they would destroy us.
1.28: Where are we going up? Our brethren have broken our heart and they said to us, ‘The people are greater and taller and stronger than we, and the cities are great and walled up unto Heaven, also we saw there the sons of the giants.’
1.29: And I said to you: ‘You shall not be afraid and you shall not be shaken by them.
1.30: LORD JEHOVAH your God goes before you and he fights for you according to all that He did with you in Egypt in your sight;
1.31: And in the wilderness you saw that LORD JEHOVAH your God nourished you as a man nourishes his son, in all the land where you went until you have come to this region.
1.32: And in this matter you do not trust in LORD JEHOVAH your God,
1.33: Who goes before you in the way to prepare a place for you that you may dwell in it; he has shown you the way that you should go in it, in fire by night and in a cloud by day.’
1.34: And LORD JEHOVAH heard the voice of your words and he was angry and he swore and said:
1.35: ‘None of these men of this evil generation shall see the good land that I swore to give your parents.
1.36: Excepting only Kalab, son of Yuphana; he shall see it, and to him and to his children I shall give the land in which he has walked, because he followed wholly after LORD JEHOVAH.’
1.37: Also LORD JEHOVAH was angry against me for your sake and he said to me: ‘Even you shall not enter there.
1.38: But surely Yeshua son of Nun who stands before you shall enter there; empower him because he shall cause Israel to possess it.
1.39: And your little ones whom you have said will be for prey, and your children who do not know good and evil today, they shall enter there, and I shall give it to them and they shall inherit it.
1.40: And you return and move to the wilderness to the way of the Sea of Reeds.’
1.41: And you answered and you said to me: ‘We have sinned before LORD JEHOVAH our God; we shall go up and we shall fight as LORD JEHOVAH our God commanded us’ and you armed yourselves to a man with the armaments of his war and you stirred yourselves up to go up the mountain.
1.42: And LORD JEHOVAH said to me: ‘Say to them, “You shall not go up and you shall not fight, because I am not among you, lest you will be defeated before your enemies.”’
1.43: And I spoke to you and you did not listen and you provoked the Word of the mouth of LORD JEHOVAH to wrath, and you were presumptuous and you went up to the mountain.
1.44: And the Amorites who dwell in that mountain went out to meet you and they chased you as smoked out wasps, and they drove you out from Seir and unto Kharma.
1.45: And you sat and you wept before LORD JEHOVAH and LORD JEHOVAH did not listen to your voice and he paid no attention.
1.46: And you stayed in Raqem many days according to the days that you stayed.’”

2.1: "And we turned and we moved to the wilderness in the way of the Sea of Reeds, as LORD JEHOVAH said to me, and we circled the mountain of Seir many days.
2.2: And LORD JEHOVAH said to me:
2.3: It has been long for you, behold, for you traveling around this mountain; turn yourselves to the north.
2.4: And command the people and say to them: "You pass over into the borders of your brethren, the children of Esau dwelling in Seir, and they will be afraid of you; be well aware:
2.5: And do not provoke them, because I have not given you an inheritance from their land among your footprints, because I have given the Mountain of Seir as a possession to Esau.
2.6: Buy produce from them with silver and eat, also buy water from them with silver and drink.
2.7: Because LORD JEHOVAH your God blessed you in all the works of your hands and he knew your course in this wilderness, behold, forty years; LORD JEHOVAH your God has been with you and you are lacking nothing.”
2.8: And we passed through from the presence of our brethren the children of Esau, dwelling in Seir, and from the way of Arabah, and from Ailath, and from Izinugaber, and we turned and we passed through the way of the wilderness of Moab.
2.9: And LORD JEHOVAH said to me: “Do not afflict the Moabites and do not provoke them to battle, because I do not give you an inheritance from their land, because I have given it an inheritance to the children of Lot.
2.10: The Amney from the first have dwelt in it, a people great and many, and as high as giants;
2.11: They are giants and those are considered also as giants, and the Moabites call them Amney.
2.12: And the Khorites dwelt in Seir from first and the children of Esau inherited them and destroyed them from before them and they dwelt in their land as did Israel in the land of his inheritance that LORD JEHOVAH gave to them.
2.13: Therefore arise, cross the Torrent of Zarad”; and we crossed the Torrent of Zarad.
2.14: And the days when we walked from Raqem d'Gaya until we crossed the Torrent of Zarad were thirty and eight years until the entire generation of the men warriors from within the camp came to an end, as LORD JEHOVAH had sworn to them.
2.15: Also, the hand of LORD JEHOVAH was on them that it would destroy them from within the camp until they were finished.
2.16: And when all of the men, the makers of war, were consumed to die from among the people.
2.17: LORD JEHOVAH spoke with me and said to me:
2.18: “You pass over the border of Moab and to Ad today:
2.19: And you shall come opposite the children of Amon; you shall not oppress them neither provoke them, because I do not give you an inheritance from the land of the children of Amon, for I have given it a possession to the children of Lot.
2.20: That was considered also a land of the giants; giants dwelt in it from the first, and the Ammonites call them Zamzemin;
2.21: A people great and many and high as giants, and LORD JEHOVAH destroyed them from before them, and they possessed them and dwelt in their land:
2.22: As the children of Esau had done, dwelling in Seir, who destroyed the Khorites from before them and they possessed them and they have dwelt in their land until today:
2.23: And the Avites who dwell in Khatsrim even unto Aza: the Qaphudqayeh—Cappadocians who had gone out from Qephaduqi—Cappadocia destroyed them and dwelt in their land.
2.24: Therefore arise, pick up camp and cross the Torrent of Arnon; see I have delivered Sihon the King of Kheshbon the Amorite and his land into your hands; begin to destroy him and provoke his people to battle.
2.25: Today I shall begin to put your awe and your trembling on the faces of the Gentiles under Heaven who will hear your fame, and they shall be shaken and shall be in awe of your presence.”
2.26: And I sent Messengers from the wilderness of Qarmuth to Sihon the King of Kheshbon with words of peace to say to him:
2.27: “We will pass through your land in the road; we will travel on the road and we will not turn away to the right or to the left.
2.28: Sell produce to us for silver and let us eat, and sell water to us for silver, and we will drink, only let us pass on our feet;
2.29: As the children of Esau dwelling in Seir had done to us, and the Moabites dwelling in Ad, until we pass over the Jordan to the land that LORD JEHOVAH our God gives to us.”
2.30: And Sihon the King of Kheshbon did not want us to cross over his border because LORD JEHOVAH your God hardened his spirit and he hardened his heart to deliver him into your hands as today.
2.31: And LORD JEHOVAH said to me: “See, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his land into your hands; begin to destroy him and to possess his land.”
2.32: And Sihon went out to meet us for battle, he and all his people, at Yehats.
2.33: And LORD JEHOVAH our God handed him over before us and we struck him with the sword, him and his children, and all his people.
2.34: And we conquered all his cities at that time and we destroyed all the cities, destroying even the women and the little ones, and we have left no survivors:
2.35: Only we captured the livestock for ourselves and the spoils of the cities that we conquered.
2.36: From Aduir upon the edge of the Torrent of Arnon and the city that is in the valley and unto Gelad, there was not a city that was stronger than we; LORD JEHOVAH our God handed them all over before us:
2.37: Only we have not approached the land of the children of Amon, everything beside the Torrent of Yabaq and villages of the mountains and all that LORD JEHOVAH our God commanded us.’”

3.1: "And we turned and we went up to the road of Mathnin and Og the King of Mathnin went out to meet us, he and all his people, to battle in Erday.
3.2: And LORD JEHOVAH said to me: 'Do not be afraid of him, because I have handed him over and all his people and his land into your hands, and do to him as you have done to Sihon the King of the Amorites who was dwelling in Kheshbon'.
3.3: And LORD JEHOVAH our God delivered into our hands also Og the King of Mathnin and all his people and we sworded him and we have not left a survivor to him.
3.4: And we conquered all his cities at that time and we have not left a city that we did not take from them: sixty cities, every portion of Argub among the Kingdom of Og that is in Mathnin.
3.5: All these cities whose walls are fortified and their gates and their bars raised, apart from very many towns of open spaces.
3.6: And we destroyed them as we did to Sihon the King of Kheshbon, for we put all his cities to the sword, to destroy even the women and the little ones.
3.7: And every beast and the spoils of the cities we plundered for ourselves.
3.8: And we took the land at that time from the hand of both the Kings of the Amorites at the crossing of Jordan, from the Torrent of Arnon and unto the mountain of Hermon;
3.9: The Tsidonians called Khermon, Seryuun, and the Amorites call it Sanir;
3.10: And all the cities of the plain, and all Gelad, and all Mathnin unto Salka, and to Ardi, all the cities of the Kingdom of Og that is in Mathnin.
3.11: For Og, the King of Mathnin, alone, was left of the rest of the giants; his bed is a bed of iron, and behold, it is in Rabath of the children of Amon; nine forearms is its length and four forearms its width, in the forearm of the giants.
3.12: And we inherited this land at that time from Aduir by the lip of the Torrent of Arnon, and half of the Mountain of Gelad and its cities I have given to Rubil and to Gad.
3.13: And the rest of Gelad and all Mathnin among the Kingdom of Og I have given to half of the tribe of Menasheh; all the portion of Argub and all Mathnin, this is called the Land of Giants.
3.14: Yair son of Manasheh took for himself all the portion of Argub unto the borders of Geshur and of Makath and he has called them by the name of Mathnin and Kaphruneyd’Yair –“Villages of Yair” until today.
3.15: And to Makir I have given Gelad.
3.16: And to Rubil and to Gad I have given from Gelad and unto the Torrent of Arnon and the inside of the valley and its border and unto Yabaq of the valley of the borders of the children of Amon;
3.17: And the desert and the Jordan and the border from Kenarath and unto the Sea of Araba, the Sea of Salt, that is under Ashdod and Pesga in Ramtha from the East.
3.18: And I commanded you at that time and I said to you: 'LORD JEHOVAH your God gave to you this land to possess it when you pass over armed before your brethren, the children of Israel, all of you mighty men of power;
3.19: Only leave your wives and your little ones and your beasts, for I know that you have much livestock; they will dwell in your villages that I have given you.
3.20: Until LORD JEHOVAH gives rest to your brethren like you, and those possess also the land that LORD JEHOVAH your God gives to you at the crossing of Jordan, and this you shall return, each man, to his inheritance that I have given to you'.
3.21: And I commanded Yeshua at that time and I said: 'Your eyes see all that LORD JEHOVAH your God did to these two Kings; in this way LORD JEHOVAH shall do to all these kingdoms through which you pass.
3.22: You shall not be afraid of them, because LORD JEHOVAH your God is The One fighting for your persons'.
3.23: And I begged before LORD JEHOVAH at that time and I said:
3.24: Please, LORD JEHOVAH God! You have begun to show your Servant your greatness and your mighty hand and your high arm! Who is God in Heaven or in the Earth to do according to your works and according to your wonders?
3.25: I shall go over now; I shall see the good land that is in the plain of Jordan, this good mountain, and Lebanon'.
3.26: And LORD JEHOVAH was angry against me because of you and he did not listen to me and LORD JEHOVAH said to me: 'It is enough for you; do not continue again to speak of this matter before me.
3.27: Come up to the top of Ramtha and lift up your eyes to the East and to the West and to the North and to the South and see it with your eyes, and you shall not cross this Jordan.
3.28: And command Yeshua and empower him and strengthen him, because he shall cross before this people and he shall cause them to inherit the land that you will see'.
3.29: And we dwelt in the valley opposite Bayth Peor.”

4.1: "Therefore Israel, hear the Law and judgments that I teach you to do today, that you shall live and you shall enter and you shall possess the land that LORD JEHOVAH, the God of your fathers, gives to you.
4.2: You shall not add to the commandment that I command you, and you shall not subtract from it, but keep the commandment of LORD JEHOVAH your God that I command to you.
4.3: Your eyes have seen everything that LORD JEHOVAH did to Baal Peor, because every man who goes after Baal Peor, LORD JEHOVAH your God shall destroy him from among you.
4.4: And you, because you were joined to LORD JEHOVAH your God, behold, you are alive, all of you, until today.
4.5: See that I have taught you the Law and judgment, just as LORD JEHOVAH my God has taught me to do them in the land that you enter to possess.
4.6: And you shall keep and you shall do them, for that is your wisdom and your understanding before the eyes of the nations who will hear all of these laws, and they shall say: ‘This great people is wise and learned.’
4.7: For what is the great people whose god is near to it as is LORD JEHOVAH our God in all that we call upon him?
4.8: And what is the great people which has righteous laws and judgments as this entire Written Law that I give before you today?
4.9: Only be very aware and keep your souls so that you will not forget any statement that your eyes see and they shall not pass away from your heart all the days of your life, and teach them to your children and to the children of your children;
4.10: The day when you stood before LORD JEHOVAH your God in Khoreeb when LORD JEHOVAH said to me: 'Gather the people before me and I shall make my word heard to them, and they shall learn to be in awe before me all the days that they live in the land and they shall teach their children'.
4.11: And you came near and you stood on the outskirts of the mountain, and the mountain was set ablaze in fire unto the heart of Heaven, and there was darkness and cloud and thick darkness.
4.12: And LORD JEHOVAH spoke with you in the mountain from within the fire; the voice that spoke you were hearing and you were not seeing a form, except the voice only.
4.13: And he showed his covenant and commanded you to do ten sayings, and he wrote them on two tablets of stone.
4.14: And LORD JEHOVAH commanded me at that time that I would teach you the laws and the judgments to do them in the land that you pass through there to inherit.
4.15: Be very aware in your souls because you did not see a form in the day when LORD JEHOVAH spoke with you in Khoreeb from within the fire:
4.16: So that you would not become corrupt and make for yourselves images and forms of every kind, a form of males or of females,
4.17: A form of any beast that is in the earth, a form of any bird of the wing flying in Heaven,
4.18: A form of any creeping thing of the earth, a form of any fish of the sea which is under the earth:
4.19: And that you would not lift up your eyes into the sky and see the sun and the moon and the stars and all the hosts of the sky and you would go astray and serve them and worship them which LORD JEHOVAH your God distributed for all the nations under Heaven.
4.20: And LORD JEHOVAH has come near you and has brought you out from the furnace of iron from Egypt, that you would be a people to him and an inheritance, as today.
4.21: And LORD JEHOVAH was angry against me because of your response and he swore that I would not cross this Jordan, and I shall not enter the good land that LORD JEHOVAH your God gives to you as an inheritance:
4.22: Because I shall die in this land and I will not cross this Jordan, but you cross and you inherit this good land.
4.23: Beware that you do not forget the covenant of LORD JEHOVAH your God which he covenanted with you and you make an image for yourselves or a form of anything that LORD JEHOVAH your God commanded you.
4.24: Because LORD JEHOVAH your God is a consuming fire and God is jealous.
4.25: And when you beget children or children of children, and you have been long in the land and you become corrupt and you make images and the forms of anything and you do evil before LORD JEHOVAH your God and you anger him:
4.26: I have called Heaven and Earth to witness before you today that certainly you shall be destroyed quickly from the land that you cross the Jordan to inherit, and you shall not multiply days in it but surely you shall be destroyed.
4.27: And LORD JEHOVAH shall scatter you among the nations and you shall be left few in number among the nations when LORD JEHOVAH your God will scatter you there.
4.28: And you shall serve gods there, the work of the hands of the children of men, of wood and of stone that do not see and do not hear and do not eat and they do not smell.
4.29: And you shall seek LORD JEHOVAH your God there, and you shall find him when you will search for him from all your heart and from all your soul.
4.30: Whenever you suffer adversity and all of these words come to you at the last of days and you are converted to LORD JEHOVAH your God and you will listen to his voice;
4.31: Because God is compassionate, LORD JEHOVAH your God will not destroy you, neither will He leave you, neither will he forget the covenant that He swore to your fathers.
4.32: But ask about the first days that have been before you, from the day that God created man on the Earth, from the ends of Heaven and unto the ends of Heaven, if there was the likes of this great matter, or there was anything heard like it?
4.33: If another people heard the voice of God who speaks from within fire as you heard, and you lived?
4.34: Or they tested God who went and took to him a nation from within a nation with trials and with signs and with wonders and with war and by a mighty hand and by a high arm and with all the great spectacles that LORD JEHOVAH your God did to the Egyptians in your sight?
4.35: You have seen and you have known that LORD JEHOVAH is God and there is none again outside of Him.
4.36: From Heaven He made His voice heard to teach you and upon the Earth has shown you His great fire, and His words He made you hear from within the fire.
4.37: And in that He loved your parents, He chose their seed after them and he brought you out in His Person, in great power from Egypt;
4.38: To destroy before you greater and mightier nations than you, that He would bring you in and would give you their land as an inheritance like today.
4.39: And you will know today and you will change your heart because LORD JEHOVAH is God in Heaven from above and upon the Earth from beneath, and there is none again outside of him.
4.40: Keep His laws and His commandments that I command you today, that it will be well for you and for your children after you, and you will multiply days in the land that LORD JEHOVAH your God gives to you for all days.
4.41: Then Moshe separated three cities at the crossing of Jordan from the dawning of the sun;
4.42: That a killer who may kill his neighbor without his will and did not hate him yesterday or the day before yesterday may escape there, and he will flee into one of these cities and he will live:
4.43: One of them : Butsar in the wilderness, in the land of the plain of Rubil, and the other Ramath Gelad of Gad, and Gulan that is in Mathnin of Menasheh.
4.44: This law Moshe appointed before the children of Israel:
4.45: These are the testimonies and the laws and judgments that Moshe spoke with the children of Israel when they went out from Egypt,
4.46: At the crossing of Jordan in the valley against Bayth Peor in the land of Sihon, the King of the Amorites, who was dwelling in Kheshbon, for Moshe and the children of Israel killed him when they went out from Egypt:
4.47: And they possessed his land and the land of Og, the King of Mathnin, two Kings of the Amorites that were at the crossing of Jordan, from the dawning the sun;
4.48: From Aduir that is on the lip of the torrent of Arnon and unto the mountain of Serion which is Khermon,
4.49: And all the desert at the crossing of Jordan from the East and unto the Sea of Araba, under Ashdod and Pesga.”

5.1: And Moshe called to all Israel and said to them: “Hear Israel, the laws and judgments that I speak before you today, that you shall learn them and keep them and do them.
5.2: LORD JEHOVAH our God has covenanted with us a covenant in Khoreeb.
5.3: It was not with our fathers that LORD JEHOVAH covenanted this covenant, but with us, we here today, and we are all alive.
5.4: Face to face LORD JEHOVAH spoke with you in the mountain from within the fire.
5.5: And I was standing between LORD JEHOVAH and you at that time to show you the words of LORD JEHOVAH your God when you were afraid before the fire and you did not go up the mountain, and he said:
5.6: ‘I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God who brought you out from the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage.
5.7: There shall not be another god for you apart from me.
5.8: You shall not make for yourselves any image or any form that is in the sky from above or that is in the earth from beneath or that is in the water beneath the land.
5.9: You shall not worship them, neither shall you serve them, because I AM LORD JEHOVAH your God, the jealous God; he pays the debt of fathers for the children to three and to four generations to those hating me.
5.10: And I perform grace to thousands of generations of my friends and to those keeping my commandments.
5.11: Do not swear in the Name of LORD JEHOVAH your God with a lie, because LORD JEHOVAH does not justify him who swears in His Name with a lie.
5.12: Keep the day of the Sabbath and hallow it as LORD JEHOVAH your God commanded you.
5.13: Six days you shall labor and you shall do all your work.
5.14: And the seventh day is the Sabbath to LORD JEHOVAH your God; you shall not do any work in it, you or your son, or your daughter, or your Servant, or your Maid, or your ox, or your donkey, or any of your beasts, or the settler that is in your town, so that your Servant and your Maid will be rested like you.
5.15: And remember that you were a Servant in Egypt and LORD JEHOVAH your God brought you out from there by a mighty hand and by an exalted arm; because of this, LORD JEHOVAH your God commanded you to keep the day of the Sabbath.
5.16: Honor your father and your mother as LORD JEHOVAH your God commanded you, that your days may be many and it may be good for you in the good land that LORD JEHOVAH your God gives to you.
5.20: You shall not testify a false testimony against your neighbor.
5.21: Do not lust for the wife of your neighbor; do not lust for the house of your neighbor, neither his field, neither his vineyard, neither his Servant, neither his Handmaid, neither his ox, neither his donkey, neither anything that your neighbor has.’
5.22: These words LORD JEHOVAH spoke with all of the assembly in the mountain from within the fire, in the cloud and in thick darkness and with a great voice without limit, and he wrote them on two tablets of stone and he gave them to me.
5.23: And when you had heard the voice from within the darkness and the mountain was blazing in fire, all of you brought me the Leaders of your tribes and your Elders.
